I must add one more thing and this would be to the person who asked who this hotel was geared toward? And to that I would add anyone and everyone who enjoys a nice quiet hotel, with the best beds, all the comforts of home and no noise. She asked about a pool, umm we are not in Phoenix, I am here in July and I never even put a pair of shorts on let alone a bathing suit. Also she mentioned you could not eat around here but not sure if she ventured 2 blocks away where they had several places to eat including several coffee shops. We did have a car with free parking and I would suggest you do that as we got to almost everywhere we needed to go within 15 to 20 minutes and the traffic was not a problem. BTW I travel all over the world and have stayed in countless hotels and I will say again it is bar far one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable lodging with high-end amenities”
Reviews.Author: Travelingismyh0bby
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay in Cedarbrook Lodge based on reviews at TA, and the place definitely did not dissapoint!! The first time my husband and I arrived at Cedarbrook Lodge, we both said, "WOW!!!" Though it is so close to Sea-Tac airport and I-5, this quiet, dreamy lodging takes you away from hustle and bustle of Seattle. Due to its location within residential area, it is better to rent a car (plus GPS) than relying on the hotel shuttle to go around the city. Don't worry, the parking is free of charge. Our room was spacious for 2 people with floor-to-ceiling window overlooking the backyard. Complimentary Starbucks house blend and Tazo teabag were nice touch. My husband was impressed by how fast the hotel's free high speed internet was. Every lodge has living rooms where free flows of fresh fruits, chocolate malt balls, chips, cheese sticks, yogurts, bottled water, and Haagen-Dazs ice cream singles are provided. My hubby and I even made time to watch TV and to read some books there. The hotel's Northwest continental breakfast was delicious, but we wished there were more food selection. My husband and I stayed for 2 nights in Cedarbrook and spent most of our time driving around Seattle. We wish we had more time to explore the lodge. We would certainly choose to stay in Cedarbrook Lodge again the next time we visit the city.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: russell78
Reviews.Content: This place is amazing! Everything about our stay was wonderful, the room, the restaurant, the"Living Room" and staff!!! We can't wait to come back to Seattle just to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty - but had to check out after way less than a day!”
Reviews.Author: anabana
Reviews.Content: Stayed there in February with my 7 year old after reading the reviews on tripadvisor. While the room was pretty, there was some sort of problem with the vent system and the room smelled like the inside of a fireplace. Switched to another room after a couple of hours and had the same problem. Was offerred to switch to another room in the morning but we switched to the Fairmont where we had no issues. I do however have to praise the staff at the hotel! My son became sick on the flight to Seattle and had a fever when we checked into the hotel. One of the staff members whose shift was ending was kind enough to go to the drugstore for me to buy a thermometer and gatorade for him. It was really appreciated!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! What a hidden gem!”
Reviews.Author: workmanb
Reviews.Content: Well worth the stay. The continental breakfast is a pleasant suprise at the least, the 24/7 complimentary snack bar is a deal MAKER. We'll be returing again and again. So nice to find a place that's close to the city but feels remote. Pricing is great too. What a suprise of a facility. Thank you to all the staff and those who make the facility great.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous grounds and beautiful locations and large rooms”
Reviews.Author: Qwackertoo
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. Will recommend to all friends visiting Seattle for business and pre & post cruise stays. The room was beautifully appointed and the very long desk area, the two closets, the very large and nicely tiled shower area and bath counters. Definitely five stars for a hotel in this price range and very comfortable. The shuttle service and driver to the airport was very courteous and helpful with all our luggage. The kids loved the H-D ice cream treats too, nice touch~!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fabulous Spot!”
Reviews.Author: Janet918
Reviews.Content: This hotel was everything we had read about in other folks' reviews. Even though it was just minutes away from SeaTac Airport, it felt like it was miles from there - very quiet and beautiful natural surroundings. It looks exactly like the pictures on the hotel website. Everything was spotlessly clean and beautiful. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful - especially loved the free shuttle service to the light rail station. The complimentary breakfast buffet each morning was stellar - best oatmeal I've ever eaten! Computers were available for our use in the Business Center, the free snacks in the living rooms were the best, and the restaurant and bar outstanding - the chef even grows his own herbs on the property! We would defintely stay here again and would recommend this place to anyone going to Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Wish we had more time to enjoy this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: JoJoLovesSummer
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and modern and included some great perks. Our favorite was the living room that included complimentary access to a variety of treats - including ice cream :) We had friends with a 9 month old stop by to visit and it was wonderful to have access to the common space.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best places we've every stayed--remarkable.”
Reviews.Author: APSSAB
Reviews.Content: Right near Sea-Tac airport. A relaxing, beautiful, and welcoming place. Everyone is very pleasant and helpful. Food was great. Room was relaxing and pleasant. Availability of snacks in living room area was unusual--and good selections as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great setting, nice room and free snacks!”
Reviews.Author: BlackberryBoy
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved our experience here, our room was decent sized, the bathroom was fantastic and the grounds were beautiful. These things alone would probably warrant a five star review and the "living room" stocked with free snacks was just icing on the cake. I have read through the reviews and though most people love this place I've noticed that a big problem for those who don't is the location and I would like to touch on this. We were on our way South on a road trip, this hotel felt very remote and I would have never seen it driving along the interstate and yet it's less than five minutes off the Interstate. As much as I loved this hotel I can't imagine staying here without a car, it's only a ten or 15 minute drive to downtown and the parking is free so it's a great base for touring Seattle by vehicle but I wouldn't try relying on their shuttle and transit it's simply too remote a location. Now that I've gotten that out of the way let's move on to the good stuff: As I mentioned the location is gorgeous. The hotel is located next to extensive wooded wetlands and they have some short paths you can stroll along as well as some pretty ponds. Our room had a nice view of the wetlands, two queen beds and a really comfortable full size chair and ottoman. The bathroom had a soaker tub and a separate shower which was really nice not to mention really comfy bathrobes. A short elevator ride was the common area they call the living room there was a fridge stocked with bottled water, yogurt and cheese strings and a freezer full of individual Hagen Daz Ice creams. There was also fresh fruit, potato chips and the yummiest malt balls on offer. This was a unique and much appreciated amenity, it was like having a mini bar without the ridiculous prices, or any price did I mention it was all free? Breakfast was not extensive but was high quality and tasty. There was homemade granola, bagels with smoked salmon and a few other items I don't recall it too was included in the price of the room. We didn't have drinks in the lounge or eat dinner in the restaurant but both looked pleasant and we probably would have it we weren't traveling with our kids. If you don't mind the slightly off the beaten path location this is a fabulous spot!

Reviews.Title: “Done it will not return”
Reviews.Author: suealways
Reviews.Content: After reading glowing reviews here we decided to stay here before and after our cruise. Service was less than expected for price paid. Our first night there was no ice cream to be found in any of the buildings and staff told us they were "out" of ice cream. Our second day/night was even worse service. We were dropped off to catch the rail to downtown. When we arrived back for pick-up -- no one answered the phone at the lodge. After numerous unanswered calls we walked over to the airport to use the curtesy phone there and again no one answered the phone at the lodge on numerous tries. We were tired, wet, and cold and needed to go back to the lodge. We finally found the number to the restuarant and they answered. They let the front desk know to come and get us. When we arrived back at the lodge I told my story to the girl at the front desk who did not show any empathy for our ordeal. I asked to speak to the manager only to be told the manager was not available. I asked if she knew the phone was not working, she said yes she did her manager called her on cell to let her know. I asked if they kept a log of customers left at the rail and she said yes. I asked if she did not think it appropriate to call us on cell as her manager had called her. No appoligies offered no concern shown -- no the service expected for price paid. The rooms were nice and the bathtub was wonderful. The grounds were nice and peaceful. The restuaurant food was decent and yes expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Really loved the complimentary snacks and the beautiful grounds”
Reviews.Author: 2011bill
Reviews.Content: Got a good price on Cedarbrook off of Hotwire. Usually stay at Super 8. This is a very nice place to stay. They have complimentary snacks 24hrs a day: yogurt, cheese sticks, ice cream, etc. 8 yr old loved walking around the grounds of the Lodge, very pretty. Rooms were very clean and comfortable. Service was with a smile and staff helped solve a couple problems we had--very flexible. My guess is the staff has the go ahead to do what they need to do to help customers out. Shuttle to airport was on time and quick.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: hutchid
Reviews.Content: Loved the complimentary EVERYTHING! The young man at the front desk was very helpful with getting us downtown on the light rail system. We absolutely will return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Liked it but didn't think it was the best place we've ever stayed”
Reviews.Author: jcrdaycare
Reviews.Content: After all the rave reviews, we thought it was going to be more special than it was. The room and bed were small, but it was picturesque, and very quiet for being so close to the airport. The staff was very nice and the shuttle was quick and efficient to the light rail system. The free snacks were a nice touch. Lunch was very good. No complaints except we didn't like the pillows which made for a rough first night. Nice bathroom. Free internet was also nice. There is free parking if you have a car.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, with great staff”
Reviews.Author: Mariusos
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel! Nice staff, and the accomadation is pretty good. Rooms are big and nice. The restaurant serves good food. Plus for having fridges stacked with complimentary ice cream and water. It's a real value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Worth the wait”
Reviews.Author: RunningNana
Reviews.Content: I had booked my 4night stay quite awhile ago and was not disappointed. We had stayed in a very nice hotel downtown Seattle and moved here to complete our vacation. We did have a car and our plane was to visit the National Parks. I loved the location. We did not use the restaurants just because we were gone all day. I loved the snacks and ice cream. The mint malted milk balls were a favorite. You are close to the interstate, light link and airport. Staff very helpful. Thanks for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Darksideemt
Reviews.Content: My new wife and I just got back from spending our honeymoon at Cedarbrook Lodge. The most important thing I have to say about our stay was how incredible this hotel is for the money. When you get to the hotel you can't believe you are just 5 minutes from the airport. The staff was very nice and helpful, especially Michael, he really gave us some good tips. This was our first trip to Seattle but would go back in a heartbeat if given the chance and would stay here everytime. Like others have said, it really is the look and the little extras that make this hotel so great. I would have given it a full 5 rating but had to hold back because I really feel they should put in a hot tub. The breakfast was good but in my opinion could use a little more variety, even if it was some eggo waffles you could pop in the toaster. Those two things are the only negative things I could come up with. The restuarant is upscale and pricey and the food is wonderful. I had the lamb and it was great. I would recommend ordering from the lounge, especially the burger and fries, they are well worth the money. They have a shuttle that will take you to the airport and the literail station by the airport which is what we did every day to get into the city. The train is $5.50 a person for an all day pass and you can walk to anywhere you would want to visit in the city, it is about a 30-40 minute ride from SeaTac to the Westlake Center which is the last stop on either end. When you are getting back to the SeaTac station just call the front desk and the shuttle will come back and pick you up. If you are going to Seattle for any reason I would strongly recommend staying here. It is more than worth the money. Thank you Cedarbrook Lodge for a honeymoon we won't forget.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, but seriously over-hyped.”
Reviews.Author: szpal
Reviews.Content: We checked out of a fabulous downtown hotel a day early just so we could stay at Cedarbrook Lodge. After reading all the glowing reviews, I was expecting something truly extraordinary. And was........quite surprised and a little disappointed. Here are the good points: Close to airport, tucked away in a residential neighborhood. Gorgeous, restful environment Free snacks Nice staff I didn't use it but the Fitness Center looked very nice. Now for the negatives: We dropped our rental car off at the airport and called for a shuttle ride from the airport kiosk. The call just kept going to voice mail. "We're sorry to have missed your call. Please leave a message." After deciding this wasn't a fluke and, indeed, there was no one answering the phone that day, I called the reservation number. We stayed on hold with her for about 10 minutes while she tried to call. Same answer. Or should I say, Same No Answer. Finally she advised us to walk down to the next island and try from there. Not sure why a different person would be manning the phone for each island, but it worked--we got to talk to a live person and requested a ride for 5 people. Our ride arrived within about 25 minutes. It was the hotel car (not a shuttle) and wasn't big enough for the 5 of us. Our five year old sat on a lap. I thought it was odd that a high rated "airport hotel" that advertises an airport shuttle, didn't seem to have their act together in this area. The rooms were beautiful but not very practical. The light was dim, not good for people who like to read at night. The tv was small and, surprisingly, not a flat screen. It was tucked away in a cabinet, on a swivel base, and seemed like an after-thought. There was no table in the room so room service had to be eaten at the desk. High points for aesthetics, low marks for usability. No pool. At this price point and with the beautiful grounds, our family was very surprised that there wasn't a pool. Indeed, there's not a lot here at all for families to do if you don't have a car. Except snack. The restaurant on-site is very expensive and the seating extremely limited (13 tables total). My husband and I enjoyed our meal there, but to take an entire family to dinner would cost a small fortune. Because this hotel is close to the airport and in a residential neighborhood, your options are seriously limited if you don't have a car. In short, I think this hotel is trying to cater to a certain type of traveler and I'm not sure exactly who that traveler is. I assume it's the business traveler on an expense account. I saw several people on their laptops sitting in the "living rooms" in each complex. It's very quiet and I can see how that would be appreciated by a business traveler. As for us, I don't think we'd stay there again. It was actually more expensive for us than our beautiful rooms at the Mayflower Park, and there just wasn't much to do once we got there. Except snack.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic lodging at end of trip”
Reviews.Author: BenjiandBruno
Reviews.Content: My 2 12 year olds and I stayed here at the end of a road trip through WA and OR. The lodge is impeccable and the service superb. There is a complementary shuttle to and from the airport and to and from the lite rail.( even after we checked out!) My kids loved the free and endless hagen daz ice cream. I unwound with a game of pool. The staff goes out of their way to accomadtae their guests. We truly felt like a guest in someone's home. We will most definitely stay here if we are in Seattle again.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: s_allenfam
Reviews.Content: For a hotel close to the airport, this one is unlike any I've ever seen! It feels like a luxury resort in the woods and is a wonderful getaway spot!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, quaint, clean hotel - a hidden gem!”
Reviews.Author: debblabs
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel a day before our cruise and we were pleasantly surprised. The free hotel shuttle picked us up at SeaTac and took us to a wooded area that was quaint and quiet. This hotel is a true hidden gem. The landscape, waterfall, wildlife and greenery were really calming. We also walked the little trail around the hotel grounds which were very pretty. You could not hear planes from your room and only a few when you were outside as it is close to the airport. Nothing out of control or really noisy though. The hotel also arranged a driver for $45.00 one way from the hotel to the cruise dock. I found this to be nicer than a cab service. The rooms are awesome. Very clean and they provided environmentally free toiletries. The fitness center was nice as well. The restaurant was an added bonus since we did not rent a car and the menu selections are good. A majority of the food was home grown or grass fed items on the menu. There was a free breakfast in the morning. Small items but still good. They had free internet as well. I would stay here again if I was in the area

Reviews.Title: “FREE ICE CREAM and SNACKS”
Reviews.Author: Cocoboba
Reviews.Content: Although the location is in them middle of a suburb, the service and the decor of the hotel is 5 stars. The lobby looks amazing with a fireplace and a nice lounge area. I actually stayed at this place in May 2010. I came back to look for it because I would always rave about this place but I forgot the name! Good job for being one of the top 25 hotels on TA Cedarbrook Lodge!

Reviews.Title: “Believe the rating!”
Reviews.Author: Superfly7
Reviews.Content: Amazing that a hotel with such comfort and amenities exists just seconds away from SEA-TAC airport. Was skeptical of the glowing reviews, now a believer.

Reviews.Title: “An incredible oasis”
Reviews.Author: gmeredith
Reviews.Content: Cedarbrook is amazing. Once you enter the hotel grounds, you feel like you are in an oasis. The staff at the hotel is friendly, efficient and customer-oriented. The rooms are luxurious. The restaurant, Copperleaf, is one of the best restaurants that I’ve ever experienced.

Reviews.Title: “Always stay here.”
Reviews.Author: osuannahh
Reviews.Content: Beautiful grounds, peaceful and safe, this is the best hotel to stay at prior to my 6am flight east. I can always count on a restful night.

Reviews.Title: “What an amazing and peaceful oasis in the City!”
Reviews.Author: Egurtel
Reviews.Content: The Cedarbrook Lodge exceeded our expectations! Loved the serene environment yet so close to great attractions...shopping, dining, Mariner's game, Pike Place Market, and so much more. We enjoyed the extra touches, especially the snacks provided in the living room area. What a treat! Can't wait until our next stay at the Cedarbrook Lodge.

Reviews.Title: “The blueprint for all hotels”
Reviews.Author: CathyEvert
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 1 night before our Alaska cruise. I have never stayed in a more peaceful, serene hotel. The setting is gorgeous with all the lush landscape, ponds and waterfalls (you would never know it is only about 5 minutes from the airport!). The rooms were immaculate. We had dinner in the restaurant and it was excellent. The staff could not have been nicer or more accommodating. Thanks to all the wonderful people at Cedarbrook Lodge who made the first night of our adventure as memorable as the glaciers and wildlife of Alaska!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Don't be afraid of the distance to town”
Reviews.Author: Philliesfan1
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel! With it, we felt as if we were able to experience both aspects that Seattle is known for-the city and the outdoors! At first we were a little hesitant to stay at a place that wasn't right in town, but their excellent shuttle service to the local transportation was so quick and easy. Town is a 30 minute easy rail ride and the shuttle was always back to pick us up within 5 minutes of us calling. the 30 minutes was definitely worth it to get away from the bustle of town. This made it very enjoyable for us to "get away" from the city with ease. The hotel was amazing with the staff being extremely courteous and the complimentary breakfast was eligant and healthy-not just cereal and muffins that disappear if you aren't the first ones there. We would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Don't judge it by the location!”
Reviews.Author: jenwaters
Reviews.Content: I booked a suite at Cedarbrook to stay the night before the wedding, as well as to have a central location for all of my bridesmaids and family to come to have their hair and makeup done before the wedding. Cedarbrook is a SeaTac hotel that doesn't look or feel like an airport hotel! The grounds are relaxing, and the suite was perfect! They even have a lounge in every building with complimentary fruit, snacks, ice cream and water - what a treat!! A couple of my bridesmaids had problems with their room (3 adults in a room with 1 queen bed and a chair?) that resulted in a bit of stress, but it was rectified after escalation. I'll be recommending Cedarbrook going forward, as a reasonably priced central airport.

Reviews.Title: “best value at any price”
Reviews.Author: jamitch63
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel - the buildings and grounds were beautiful, the rooms very spacious, bathrooms huge, continental breakfast above average. The living room/snack room was unexpected and extremely appreciated and the staff couldn't have been more welcoming or helpful. Would recommend this hotel as a great value for the price - is near the airport but you'd never know it, and shuttle service was provided for the light rail to get downtown.

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE ... NOT WHAT IT'S CRACKED-UP TO BE.”
Reviews.Author: Fiona98382
Reviews.Content: Reserved a double queen - well in advance - and held it with a credit card. Arrived to be told there were no double rooms available and we would need two seperate rooms. When I expressed my disappointment, suddenly the front desk said they had a double room, but were holding it for a family with small children. Since it was my adult daughter & me (Even though I hadn't seen her in 6 months), I reluctanly agreed to the two rooms so as not to put out the family w/ small children. Arrived in the rooms to find them VERY stark and disgustingly dirty - no furniture - only pull-down hollywood beds, extremely stained carpeting and fresh coffee ring stains on the counter. No toiletries or coffe pot / coffee. Called the front desk to ask why no coffee / toiletries and what these rooms are used for because they are obviously not guest rooms. (The television was a tiny one tucked into the hallway, which you could not watch unless you stood in front of it!) They avoided my question and said they would send housekeeping over with coffee and etc. Again, no apology and treating me like I was putting them out. A housekeeping young man arrived with one coffee pot without a handle. Said it was the only one he could find and still had no coffee or toiletries. I asked him what these rooms were used for and he said they were really meeting rooms - not guest rooms. I went back to the front desk and said I was not told the rooms were meeting rooms and wanted the double room after all - it's what I had reserved and paid for. The front desk was extremely rude - especially the young man - and insisted they were no rooms - they were completely sold out. Once again, suddenly the girl at the desk said they had a double and would put me in that one. She then proceeded to scold me and said "I gave you a choice and this is what YOU took." (??!!##) I had never been treated that way before and I was only wanting WHAT I RESERVED AND PAID FOR! There was NEVER an apology for the inconvenience they put ME through - they acted as if I was at fault. I did not simply walk in off the street - I had a reservation for a double room and the confirmation paper with me! This definitely ruined our stay at Cedarbrook and I wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone I care about. I think their 15 minutes of fame that Trip Advisor gave them has gone to their head. I'd like to know who at Trip Advisor decided to name Cedarbrook as "Best" hotel. FAR FROM IT!

Reviews.Title: “A special place”
Reviews.Author: ckeller81
Reviews.Content: Spent 1 night here before going to Vancouver in the middle of a 15 day Northwest vacation, back tonight. This is a special place. The staff is wonderful, and the complimentary breakfast is special. They do a lot of little things that make it feel like a hotel that cost twice as much. There is a central living room stocked with free food ranging from fruit, ice cream, candy, chips, bottled water, etc. The grounds are beautiful, and the rooms have a great shower, 600 count sheets, Starbucks coffee, and very comfy robes. The rooms are not as large as some other hotels, but who cares?

Reviews.Title: “You MUST stay here!”
Reviews.Author: ratty_32
Reviews.Content: I had SUCH an amazing experience at Cedarbrook. My fiance' (at the time) and I booked it for the Friday night prior to and the night of our wedding. We booked about 6 months in advance. The staff was friendly, took us around, showed us the rooms, failities and grounds. We booked it then. When we came back 2 weeks prior, they remembered our NAMES! Not only that, but there was a small glitch in the booking and they fixed it - no problem. I stayed in a suite and adjoining room with my bridesmaids the night before. It was perfect for hanging out, and we loved the "living room" and snacks :) The wedding day was perfect. Spacious enough for lots of getting-ready and we used the adjoining room (closed off by then of course) for the groomsmen. The grounds were beautiful for photos. I highly, HIGHLY recommend staying here. It was a wonderful experience . . . one I will never forget :)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfuly hidden secret”
Reviews.Author: lejaj
Reviews.Content: Driving towards the hotel, the environment leading to the entrance makes you wonder if you made a mistake. However, once you enter the property, you find a wonderful lodge like hotel ensconced in a beautiful natural setting. The staff were terrific and the regulars I saw quickly learned my name. I felt important and quite comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Airport hotel with character”
Reviews.Author: Sandal95
Reviews.Content: I did everything online. It was easy and the price was comparable to any hotel near the airport. Check-in and check-out was a breeze. Loved the grounds and took a nature walk. Definately will be back when I'm in the area again.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't want to leave”
Reviews.Author: Butski
Reviews.Content: An oasis close to the airport. Beautiful lodge and grounds. Rooms were spacious, lots of storage and workspace in room. Snacks in the living room area were great. Helpful staff. Will definitely stay again when in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “A thoughtful approach to hotelery”
Reviews.Author: Wbm5
Reviews.Content: Beautiful, peaceful grounds; hard to believe it's so close to Sea-Tac airport. Rooms are large, simply appointed but tasteful. Bathroom products top-shelf. The "living room" concept is well appreciated (help yourself to water, Hagen Daaz ice cream. Other treats). We stayed in a top floor, corner room. Very quiet, peaceful. Floor to ceiling windows look out over greenery. Will definitely stay there again if need to be near airport. Great continental bkfst. Nice folks.

Reviews.Title: “This Is One Unique and Fabulous Property”
Reviews.Author: ValuingTraveler
Reviews.Content: Before my stay, I couldn't have believed this property would have climbed to the #1 position in Seattle - after my stay I understand. This is a wonderful, welcoming venue in a calm, serene, lush setting. The grounds are lovely, the rooms are nicely appointed, the mattress, pillows and bedding are phenomenal. Most importantly, the staff could not be more friendly and helpful. You can sit in one of the outdoor patios, look up to the clouds and see the flights taking off from SeaTac, and smile, knowing that you will sleep like a baby in the incredibly quiet guest rooms, and awake the next morning to a fresh, fabulous and tasty natural continental breakfast. It's worth planning your time in Seattle to stay in this hotel - yes, you may have to deal with the I-5 corridor if you're car-bound, but you could as easily take advantage of the light-rail shuttle service to the central city. Try it; I think you too will be surprised and delighted - oh, your wallet will thank you too.

Reviews.Title: “A Surprise - Will stay again!”
Reviews.Author: Oli0612
Reviews.Content: Located very close to the airport and a big shopping mall. We drove there, so I am not sure about public transportation around the lodge. It is abit off the main road. The lobby looked really nice, and so did the room. Very secured. Every time you want to enter a certain building, you would need to scan you room key. The room wasn't big, but good enough. I have to mention the 'lobby' in each building. They have complimentary DVD for you to watch, free chocolates, yogurts, water, cheese sticks, fruits, chips and Haagen-Daz ice-cream (different flavours)!! They also have a huge fridge and a microwave, which we managed to use. We had leftovers from dinner. Gym was well-equipped and very clean. I have to say, I wasn't very happy with the breakfast. We did have a late check-out, but I woke up just for the breakfast and have wished I didn't. But overall, a very good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Business Meeting Location”
Reviews.Author: bellaviaggiatore
Reviews.Content: The Cedarbrook Lodge turned out to be a good location for a business meeting and convenient to the airport for a quick trip.

Reviews.Title: “Mmmmm......”
Reviews.Author: Brightievictoria
Reviews.Content: I chose it as a special place for our last night in the US, and frankly I think it is over-rated. Yes, the setting is lovely, the lodge is superbly furnished, and the service and airport shuttle are good. You pay highly for it. But the room was small and crowded with furniture, and in a separate building a considerable distance from reception - needing to trundle suitcases outside to get there. Without a car, there is no option but to dine in. The dinner menu is short. Pretentious descriptions of the meals often hide lesser quality food, and not much of it. (Stinging nettles as part of the vegetables may be 'gourmet' but are not an attraction). We've been lucky to dine in fine restaurants all over the world, and this was not one of them. Breakfast was included in the price, but is not served until 6.30am, which means travellers with an early flight miss out. It would so easy to provide a continental breakfast tray for early check-outs. Thoughtless. The Lodge is obviously excellent for conferences, but for overnight stays near the airport, try somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “You really do not have a choice!”
Reviews.Author: gelacor
Reviews.Content: We stayed with two other families at Cedarbrook Lodge on our way to Alaska via Seattle. Our stay surpassed our expectations across the board. Easy in and out to the airport via the shuttle, the staff was superb, rooms were immaculate but the thing we were most impressed with was the decor and the grounds. If you have the chance and you are in the area stay here! I would bet that if you travel in this area often you will return - you really do not have a choice.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: josanpu
Reviews.Content: All so good. THE airport hotel for me. I wish I could spend more time here.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in Seattle!”
Reviews.Author: Saoirse3
Reviews.Content: The ONLY thing wrong with the Cedarbrook Lodge is that it's in Seattle (one of the rudest cities I have ever been in). Cedarbrook is like an oasis in the middle of all of that. 24/7 snacks. The free buffet breakfast is to die for. Lox and capers for my bagel? Wow! The rooms are awesome. A perfect 10!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay!”
Reviews.Author: silversurfer340
Reviews.Content: All the excellent reviews are true. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel highly recommend.”
Reviews.Author: Anibas44
Reviews.Content: Price was great. Hotel was lovely and had a great restaurant & bar. Very clean with free snacks in common area. Highly recommend for business or family travel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location/Setting - Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: csmarion
Reviews.Content: Quiet, Each building has an open living area for conversation, watching a game, movie...included free snacks...chips, candy, yogurt, ice cream, water. Nice gathering area. If you are in to fitness, big room with everythng you need. Outside patio area looks setup with a fireplace and heating for in the cooler days, and is close to the bar. Very nice. Does not have a spa or swimming pool.

Reviews.Title: “Surprising and friendly oasis near the airport.”
Reviews.Author: MikenDavid
Reviews.Content: Really friendly and welcoming staff with youthful enthusiasm. Each time we were shuttled to and from airport and light rail station, driver and staff were lively and fun. They made the place feel more like a familiar home base than an airport hotel. Nice oasis, especially since it is almost next to the airport. Landscape setting and contemporary lodge look create a surprising get-away right smack in the suburban neighborhood. Nice alternative to staying downtown because staff will drop off and pick up from the nearby light rail station.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: sentosa54
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights post cruise. We took a shuttle from the cruise ship to the airport and then used the free shuttle to Cedarbrook Lodge. Room was amazing, spotlessly clean , loved the relaxing chair by the window. Bed was very comfy with lovely white linens. Lots of storage space, iron and ironing board, great coffee machine. Bathroom was big with a great 'soaker tub', very relaxing after a day's sight seeing. Loved the snacks and bottled water in the lounge of each building Had dinner in the restaurant and found the room to be quite cool, asked our server Peter if the air con was on and he replied that the breeze was because the bar door was open Had dinner the second night in the bar where it was warmer, my meal, however was atrocious.I ordered a Grilled Chicken Sandwich and it came with fries that were burnt and had been cooked in oil that was not fresh . I did complain and was not charged. Breakfast was lovely, bagels, toast, boiled eggs, muffins,fruit, yoghurt, smoked salmon, cereals, juice, tea and coffee, perfect start to the day. Great free Internet. The shuttle also goes to a Mall and the light Rail Station which made it very easy to go downtown. We used the Pink hop on hop off tour bus and found it disappointing, after we had paid and the bus started moving, we were told that the time between stop pickups that day would be one hour. Will stay at Cedarbrook Lodge again but will find somewhere else to eat in the evenings

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel, better than we expected even after reading the reviews”
Reviews.Author: Austrav27
Reviews.Content: After a long trip from Australia this was a fabulous place to start our Alaskan adventure. Very friendly staff, great shuttle service, we stayed in one of the suites at a slightly higher rate but it was a great room. Very convenient to the airport and light rail into Seattle proper

Reviews.Title: “amazing place!!”
Reviews.Author: iltraveler77
Reviews.Content: Wow...this place is just an amazing value. The scenery is beautiful, the service is great, and the rooms are very nice. I would love to go back there for a little get-away. It's amazing to have this experience in a hotel near the airport. It feels like it's a world away. Also, the hotel restaurant is incredible for dinner and the breakfast is very good too. I'm a tough critic but loved this place. The only suggestion I have is that the beds could be just a little more plush. But, the attention to detail to everything else is really amazing...from the free drinks and snacks in the lounges to the Scandinavian feel of the decor.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is a well kept secret, a diamond in the rough.”
Reviews.Author: Susieq1920
Reviews.Content: Close to SeaTac, the hotel provides personalized service. Each employee provided the service with sincerity. Unlike other airport hotels, we heard no jet noise at night. The van driver/desk clerk made reservations at the restaurant for a late dinner where we enjoyed a most interesting, tasty dinner. Surely, this restaurant will be come a destination dining location. The variety of foods at the breakfast was suitable, hours of operation fit our plane getaway mid-morning. The 'living rooms' at our 'home' was cozy. The idea of ice cream and other snacks (free) is nice. The grounds were quite appealing and well kept. This was truly an enjoyable experience. Value for dollar is most reasonable. I would have expected to pay a great deal more for a like room elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Not to be missed”
Reviews.Author: 2Kolohe
Reviews.Content: My friends and I had the opportunity to stay at the Cedarbrook Lodge before and after our Alaska trip. The first time we stayed for 3 days. We rented a car so getting to the lodge was a breeze. Five minutes from the airport and your're there. When we arrived we couldn't believe our eyes how peaceful and hidden this place was among residences. When I entered my eyes could not believe the beauty and openess of the area. Here's what we liked on both of our stay: 1. Check in - fast and swift. in five minutes I had our room keys and we were off to our room 2. Check in Staff - polite and very professional. Also very helpful in getting around 3. Room - spacious and very clean 4. Bathroom - to die for. Very spacious. Deep soaking tub. Very very clean. Tolietries were excellent. 5. Free parking 6. Breakfast - free. Not many choices but enough to fill the stomach. They even have salmon. 7. Grounds - immaculate. Wish we had more time to walk around 8. Living Room - free yogurt, candy, Hagen Das Ice Cream, fruits and Bottle Water 9. Free Shuttle - they picked us up at the airport after we dropped our rent a car the day before leaving. They run 24/7. 10. Fitness room - really clean and a good choice of machines and weights 11. Business Center - 5 computers, printer and shredder. Get to print boarding passes the day before you leave What we hated - we had to leave. Make no doubt about it, we will definitely stay here again when we return to Seattle. This place is to die for.

Reviews.Title: “Why Leave? I want to move in!”
Reviews.Author: FamilyTraveler0978
Reviews.Content: Who would think that being feet away from the an Airport could be so close to heaven. This little spot exudes, care, grounding - peace and tranquility. The food is exquisite - the space is welcoming. And I am so fond of the snacks - and the attentive staff. I love Cedarbrook Lodge. It is a great place to rest. to have a meeting and recharge - or a starting point to explore the area.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in a wonderful natural setting.”
Reviews.Author: piquet49
Reviews.Content: A wonderful place. The setting, in basically a garden or wood was wonderful. Free ice cream and other snacks available in the living room was a great bonus. The room was perfect with a view of lush greenery and I slept like a baby. The restaurant is outstanding. Overall a most wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Unique - a real gem!”
Reviews.Author: Gunya
Reviews.Content: Chose this because of the great reviews on this site and it did not disappoint. Friendly staff, beautiful grounds, nice rooms, lots of lovely wood used in construction, free ice creams, yoghurt etc in the common areas. I only wish that we weren't doing a rushed overnighter because this was a special place.

Reviews.Title: “Pampered feeling without emptying my wallet”
Reviews.Author: smartieray
Reviews.Content: Nice, quiet place in a residential neighborhood, around the corner from Seatac. Friendly, professional staff and an awesome chef who knows what he is doing. Price was good and they have little benefits thrown in to make you feel special. I would stay again (for pleasure, not just business). Glad I found this little gem.

Reviews.Title: “This is a a great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: missedme
Reviews.Content: This place was probably the nicest hotel I have ever stayed in. The price was ecellent, the room was awesome, the scenery around this place is nothing but beautiful, and the complimentary snacks were pretty awesome too. It is absolutely amazing that this place is in the middle of Seattle, almost right next to the airport. We only stayed here one night, but if we ever go back to Seattle again this hotel is definitely our hotel of choice.

Reviews.Title: “The most extraordinary facility for comfort, service, beauty, food and sleep.”
Reviews.Author: fredvanliew
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for two nights.This property exceeds the reviews in every sense. The quality of the furniture, the bedding, the bathrooms, the room size, the views, the service are above anything I have experienced recently in extensive travels. The service of all staff members consistently went beyond expectations. It is not possible to write a review of this length and put in the many niceties Cedarbrook Lodge offers. Their business facilities are gorgeous as well. The only choice for Seattle, and only five minutes from the airport, although you would never know it. The tram station goes downtown for under $3. Amazing! Even the water, Haagen Daz Icecream and snacks at no additional cost were a pleasant surprise. The restaurant provided the best lamb I have eaten in years. My wife's fish and chips were better than Elliots downtown.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Ever!”
Reviews.Author: seniormkt
Reviews.Content: This is the hotel experience to wish for. Everything was near perfect or better. Even the continental breakfast was delightful including smoked salmon, Italian cold cuts, hot cereal, juices, coffees, etc, and the complimentary treats available 24 hours a day in the various lounges were fine including chocolate candies, yoghurts, bottled water, Haggen Daaz ice cream, fruit and chips were very convenient and satisfying. The PC area had 6+ computers and the fitness center large and varied. For swimmers, there is a rather new Y across the street that makes their pools available for a small daily charge. The grounds are great for walking, the common areas spotless and the rooms spotless. Cannot be more encouraging without sounding like we are from management.

Reviews.Title: “I won't stay anywhere but Cedarbrook Lodge from now on!”
Reviews.Author: Memyselfanddeb
Reviews.Content: Imagine a beautiful river running just outside your "cabin." This cabin comes complete with a monster bathtub that accomodates very long legs, lovely cedar EVERYWHERE and an amazing view into a protected park. Now combine that with a "living room" area where you can grab a complimentary yogurt, water, or gourmet chips in the dead of night, a restaurant that excells in amazingly fresh produce, a chef that grows his own herbs on property and more tv channels than you'll ever need. One last thing, it's cheap! Way cheap in commarison. Free wi-fi and parking. The staff was beyond stellar and I bought one of the house robes I loved it so much. I travel at least once a month and I've never enjoyed a location more.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: dr_tiffcliff
Reviews.Content: The reviews are correct; this is an exceptional hotel that is near SEATAC. A true oasis with wonderful service, quick airport access, and easy access to the light rail. The staff were friendly, helpful, and competent. The comp. light snacks and breakfast were excellent (they don't skimp on food quality -- Starbucks coffee and Mightly Leaf Tea, for example...). Overall, one of the best hotels I've experienced...definitely a best value.

Reviews.Title: “Best near-airport hotel ever, but insist on 3rd floor & eat at restaurant”
Reviews.Author: goocean
Reviews.Content: Nicely build/decorated hotel and grounds -- open timber feeling, tasteful and soothing. Amazingly quiet for airport proximity. Copperleaf restaurant really tiny and truly excellent -- make a reservation, order fish, and leave room for the cocoa and fresh donuts for two dessert. Beds were o.k. -- not bad, not great. Room with 2 queen beds only had one sitting chair and no couch to chat at. Second floor rooms with large windows are right next to walkways with no privacy whatsoever. Hotel staff tried to tell me that our room configuration didn't exist on third floor (it did!). We pushed and ended up in nice 3rd floor room with the needed 2 Q beds -- much better. Very uneven staffing -- some marvelously knowlegeable/helpful/friendly folks, some who seemed clueless or just didn't care. Good/responsive shuttle service to airport (even multiple trips).

Reviews.Title: “How ALL hotels should provide service!”
Reviews.Author: thewonderdrummer
Reviews.Content: The reviews on this hotel not only are absolutely true, but don't even fully describe the level of comfort. The rooms are spacious and comfortable (although it would be nice to have a King Bed option available), the living rooms are an INCREDIBLE idea and EVERY hotel should offer such a service! Little things I appreciated were the fantastic wifi (13mb up AND down...unheard of for free!), the living room snacks, the spacious and comfortable bathroom accomodations (all rooms have a spa-tub!), the free transportation to local light-rail and airport, and the incredibly personal touch the hotel and staff have.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: tifffun
Reviews.Content: My friend and I traveled to Seattle for a shopping weekend. We were extreemly happy with all aspects of this hotel. The shuttle service was great, the rooms were nice and the grounds were beautiful. Above all this the quality of service was exceptional. We would choose this hotel everytime we visit Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “A Superb Gem of a Hotel near SEA/TAC Airport.”
Reviews.Author: 4tomorrow
Reviews.Content: This hotel exceeded my expectations in every conceiveable way. The grounds, the architectural design of the lodge, the all-natural food in the meals, the complimentary amenities of chips, water, yogurt covered pretzels, string cheese, yogurt, and ice cream in the "living room" situated between the hotel suites. The staff were helpful and courteous. The ambiance was superb. The hotel looked brand new. Everything about the lodge and our room was excellent, outstandingly clean and comfortable. Fine linens on the bed, and a huge bathtub to soak in after a long trip from Victoria, B.C. that day.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent rooms and excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: jag1123
Reviews.Content: I never want to stay anywhere else in Seattle again. Cedarbrook is not only very comfortable, but the services and the staff are way above others in the area. The grounds are beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “A gem near Seattle/Tacoma airport!”
Reviews.Author: Norseman22
Reviews.Content: Everything about my stay was outstanding. All the staff I dealt with (clerk, waitress, bartender, airport shuttle driver) were incredibly friendly and helpful. The hotel is set in a lovely, quiet, green area, with a few short walking paths along a small creek - definitely a surprise for a hotel I booked primarily based on proximity to the airport! My room, was clean, comfortable, and had good quality free wifi. As a bonus, each lodge has a common living area with fireplace, TV, and free snacks (chips, some types of chocolates, yogurt, fruit, and even Häagen-Dazs ice cream!). Finally, the restaurant and bar war fantastic. The restaurant specializes in fresh, local ingredients and has a great menu - try the homemade cherry and pistachio sausages! The bar features local microbrew beer and local wines, and has an excellent selection. I can't say enough good things about this hotel - I got far more than I expected for a short overnight stay before flying out in the morning. I will definitely stay here again the next time I fly through Seattle!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, beautiful and relaxing stay”
Reviews.Author: aprildiamond
Reviews.Content: If you enjoy comfort and a peaceful, beautiful atmosphere, Cedarbrook Lodge is the place for you. The cedar walls gave it a lodge-like feeling, welcoming and warm. The staff were very helpful and patient with me, and I enjoyed unwinding in the "living rooms" that were stocked with snacks and had comfortable couches, a TV and huge fireplace. After I took a refreshing walk around the property to enjoy the landscaping, I warmed myself by the fire and ate a cup of Hagan-Daas ice cream before retiring to my room. I was also pleased with the high-speed Internet available.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional value, service, and comfort with elegant campus in pristine woodland setting”
Reviews.Author: Z3PO
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel if you can even call it that. It is more of an escape. The campus is elegant, beautiful, and creates a great tie to nature. It is very spacious, comfortable in meeting rooms, personal rooms, and community areas. Restaurant, bar are exceptional with great ambiance and amazing food. The service is also 5start. I did not want to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Less than expected”
Reviews.Author: Archie's Mom
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a vacation in Victoria, B.C. and Seattle. We stayed for 5 days in a Seattle hotel very well-reviewed on this site. It was fabulous. But we had an early flight so we moved to Cedarbrook for the last day. I had read glowing reviews, so I thought it would be a good finish to our trip. I liked the photo of the studio with fireplace, so I reserved it. So far, so good. We arrived to the information from the desk clerk that there was no bellman to help my 75 year-old husband with the bags. Really? For a $235 room? We parked extremely far from our room because the lot was at the exact opposite end of the building from our room. Big pain for my husband. The room was large... very large and bare. One Murphy bed, two easy chairs and many, many built-in cabinets and drawers. I counted 24 cabinets and shelves. Wow! This could have been an apartment with great storage. But it was a hotel room with no luggage rack, nothing for the suitcase. The entry space into the room was 8x8 and bare, except for a vanity with no chair. Also, a small overhead light was not enough to make the vanity usable. I had a strong feeling that the room had had another, happier life. It was just too sparse that I feel sure no decorator planned for it to appear as it did. Too bad it was not completely refitted for a hotel room.The bath was 9 feet long with one little 12" towel bar near the far end. Otherwise, bare wall.Very strange decor, but the bathtub itself was deep and lovely. I know this may sound picky, but we had just left a fabulous hotel for the same price, with bell hops, great service, fresh flowers. And great free wireless. Cedarbrook advertises free wireless, but not in our room. Nada. I called the front desk and was told that it didn't quite reach all the way to the end of the hall but I could walk to the desk with my laptop and turn it on there, get online and then walk back to my room and usually the wireless would keep working. I am not making this up! I never got a signal at all. The restaurant was beautiful and the food was great. We had dinner, no drinks and a bottle of wine for $175. Well it was good food and good service. We did not eat the continental breakfast included with the room because we had to spend that time hustling our bags back to the car. We travel frequently with no budget issues. But I know a good value for a great place, and Cedarbrook is not it. The hotel advertises as a great place for a conference or a wedding. This might be true. There are little living rooms in the middle of the halls with a frig filled with ice cream and other treats. Maybe this works well for togetherness for a large group. I would have preferred a little frig. in my own room, however. All in all ,we will not be back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel & Restaurant”
Reviews.Author: Lraep
Reviews.Content: We've planned to visit the Hotel Restaurant. After knowing it's located inside a hotel, we did the hotel search & were happy to find out it was the #1 Hotel on tripadvisor, which we've always trusted. Since we didn't need to start our days early, we reckoned it's okay that we'd need to commune for 20 mins. every morning to Bellevue, which was our purpose of visit. Check-in was speedy & professional. The 2 front-receptionist were extremely smart and caring. They even knew we made reservation at the Restaurant, which I booked via Opentable. Dinner was excellent. We tried their "Earth Day" tasting menu @$49 + $30 for wine-pairing. The Hotel "Living Room" has an abundant supply of complimentary water, chips, chocolate, cheese string, yugurt, and Haagen-daz ice-cream. Bathroom amenities were of good quality and environmental-friendly. My only dislike was the bed was too soft, and the air-con slightly blew on my face. The complimentary breakfast, though lacking variety, was delicious, including bread, bagel, muffin, cereal, salmon, salami, etc. We absolutely enjoyed our stay, and will definitely consider this Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the hype”
Reviews.Author: emca4
Reviews.Content: I didn't actually get to evaluate any qualities of the hotel past the customer service because the reservation i made 2 months in advance was apparently not good enough to secure a room for myself. Now I'm sitting at a less than comparable hotel with a lovely parking lot view. Don't stay here. Save your reservations for some place more reliable.

Reviews.Title: “Not reliable”
Reviews.Author: jschn_2000
Reviews.Content: I booked this lodge months before an anticipated stay in the Seattle area, based partly on a trip Advisor rating of 10 best places to stay in the country. When I arrived, I was told they didn't have a room for me. And got shuttled off to a Doubletree, to a room with a view of a parking lot. I am very disappointed!!

Reviews.Title: “Not helpful when changes were needed”
Reviews.Author: Akranoi
Reviews.Content: Due to work circumstances i couldn't control i was not able to keep a reservation i made. I knew it was a 21 day advance non refundable reservation, but i was hoping that i would at least be able to apply some of the money to a new reservation. Unfortunately, the reservation person was not willing to help me at all. The online reservation terms states that the $ can't be applied to an existing reservation, but does not state anything about applying $ to a new reservation. Even airlines are willing to apply your non-refundable money to a new reservation. I was looking forward to trying the hotel, but not anymore.

Reviews.Title: “Must Stay Again!!”
Reviews.Author: Hayzel01
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure of staying at this wonderful hotel when we were in Seattle. Thanks to all of the reviews on TripAdvisor, I went ahead and made reservations for two rooms for my family and in-laws. I am very particular about where I stay and even the best of hotels can sometimes be a hit and miss. I have to tell you that this hotel exceeded all of my expectations and more. The rooms were ample in size, very clean and well kept. I could have stayed a couple of nights and would not have complained one bit.

Reviews.Title: “A diamond in the rough”
Reviews.Author: Vinodiva
Reviews.Content: I travel for business and pleasure often - This hotel was amazing - beautiful, greatly located by the airport, flowers and fireplace and huge tub - "free snacks" Really a great place - a unexpected surprise

Reviews.Title: “A hidden treasure”
Reviews.Author: yukoncanada
Reviews.Content: After a long day of travel this place feels like you have been transported to a tranquil spot far from the city. Hard to believe that you are only 10 minutes from the airport. Spent one night in a regular room on the start of our holiday and one night in the suite on the way home. The suite is worth every extra penny and is very reasonably priced. It was located on the end of one of the buildings and had huge windows overlooking the grounds. The staff are very helpful and professional and offer a high level of service. The continental breakfast was top notch. I will not consider staying anywhere else when flying out of Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Love this place”
Reviews.Author: Granolamama
Reviews.Content: This is our third stay here. Last year we bookended a trip to Seattle. This year we flew back to Sea/Tac to explore Oregon and had to stay at Cedarbrook again! We love this place! We love the look and feel of the modern but comfortable architecture and soft lights. My kids love it also. We love the family room with the snacks, especially with a late flight...cheese sticks, water and yogurt hit the spot at midnight. The candy and the ice cream are also fun for that "must have" treat...just because. The rooms are not huge, but nicely set up and comforabel with good products in the bathroom AND you can brew Starbucks while showering..not a bad way to start a Seattle trip. The breakfast has moved to a bigger room and the lobby changed somewhat also, but it is very nice. It is not a super family friendly place, not much for kids to do, but it is a great place to sleep and have breakfast...kids can deal without the pool and snack machines! The breakfast has terrific oatmeal and granola that I often replicate at home. I just can't say enough about how much I like this hotel. The price went up quite a bit from last year, I am sure it will continue to do so as it gains popularity. I will be sad then, because it is a great location to the airport and our family loves it there...even without the pool and junk!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AlaskaCouple2008
Reviews.Content: The hotel was awesome, check in was super fast and the clerk could not be bothered to tell us about the hotel amenities, there is a room with candy and snacks and even bottled water and ice cream, which we did not discover until we were checking out. The rooms were beautiful with so many channels to watch, many more than you expect in a hotel. Good quality soap and products in the room and even a robe for your use. The restaurant is very expensive, well, we went into the lounge and ordered. I had the pear salad and it was priced at $12 or $14, and there was literally 10 bites of food on that plate. I KNEW I was going to leave hungry, and I am not a big eater. My husband ordered the prawns, and there were 5 on the plate for $16, they came with the head and shell still on them, I would call them shrimp and not prawns. While the food was good, I am never happy when I leave hungry. If they had given us a basket of bread it would have left a completely different impression.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay in every way”
Reviews.Author: mcfour
Reviews.Content: Loved our stay. We would stay here again. Close to shopping and restaurants. Very clean, quiet and comfortable. Lovely complimentary breakfast. Loved the snacks offered in the living room. Beautiful grounds and buildings. Not a long drive to downtown Seattle. Friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable luxury and convenience”
Reviews.Author: AnelaS
Reviews.Content: Traveling back from Vacouver, Canada to Hawaii via Seattle - we needed a room for one night that was close to the SEA-TAC airport. We arrived by train - an the complimentary Cedarbrook Lodge shuttle picked us up at the Amtrak platform - later the drove us to the shopping mall for dinner an the next day to the airport - such a valuable service. The grounds and rooms were beautiful and well maintained and it felt like a luxury hideaway. The fitness center and equipment were all in excellent condition. With complimentary snacks available 24/7 and continental breakfast in the morning - it was an exceptional value. Wish we stayed longer. Three thumbs up from our family that included a 16 year old. Definately at the top of my recommendation list.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Wonderful...”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaBBTravel
Reviews.Content: Recently visited Cedarbrook at the end of our Canadian/Seatle vacation. We booked here for only one night, but wished we had booked additional nights earlier in our trip. Right near the airport but you would never know it.. A modern - zen like lobby with leather sofas and even a large open deck for dining and having a drink. I don't think anyplace can compare, the rooms were a bit narrow, but the ameniies more than made up for this. Down the hall, snacks, water, and frigs stocked with water and ice cream at no additional charge! I can't say enough about this venue, what a nice surprise by the Airport!!

Reviews.Title: “Staycation”
Reviews.Author: boomer1960
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely place. You feel like you are secluded in the woods, but you are moments away from the airport and the city. We had a hassle free trip into Seattle via the link lite rail. The rooms are small, but cozy. The bathrooms are large. The TV's are not so great. We did not have local channels for most of our stay. There are free snacks in the "Livingroom" this is a nice fun feature. I would stay here again. We had a nice room looking over wetlands and cherry trees. There is a walking path. They have complimently breakfast which was nice. We ate dinner in the nice but very small bar, the food was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis of Tasteful Decor and Comfortable Amenities”
Reviews.Author: Mellowmom
Reviews.Content: What a pleasant surprise for a Sea Tac area hotel!! Gorgeous grounds, beautiful west coast styling, large comfortable rooms, convenient shuttle service to and from the airport and to the local Westfield Mall. Travelling with an always hungry teenager, so being able to access the free snacks 24 hours with 'bad' and 'good' choices and water bottles excellent addition. Also a nicely varied selection at the breakfast buffet with healthy options. I will return on the way back through the Sea Tac area next week and look forward to dining in the Copperleaf- the menu looks very intriguing!! Would not hesitate to return or recommend to friends and co- workers

Reviews.Title: “Quietest stay we've ever experienced”
Reviews.Author: Smityd99
Reviews.Content: We checked in late after a delayed flight out of SeaTac. An expansive property with running creeks and wooded surroundings. The sight used to be used as a retreat center (for the big wigs, I'm told) for a US bank. It's open and welcoming. The most amazing part is that it's the quietest hotel I've ever stayed in. With a nearly full house, you'd never know there was anyone else here. Great beds. Big rooms. A wonderful find!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel close to airport”
Reviews.Author: abbiel
Reviews.Content: The Cedarbrook Lodge is unique, spacious and welcoming. Attractive large guest rooms with floor to ceiling windows, cherry trees and hummingbirds outside. Common areas are comfortable, with fireplaces, books, bottled water and snacks. Nice restaurant (reservations required), or eat in the bar area anytime. Airport is only 5-10 minutes away, and the shuttle begins at 4 a.m. The only thing that was missing was a gift shop or vending machines to get sodas or snacks.

Reviews.Title: “One of my best stays ever!”
Reviews.Author: dude_74_1998
Reviews.Content: I have done a lot of business travel and have stayed mostly at 4-5 star hotels. Actually my wife did the research for the Seattle area and she advised me to consider Cedarbrook Lodge. Her research has never been a shot in the dark, she is quite thorough. I was in Alaska for a two month stay and when I arrived at Cedarbrook Lodge I was taken aback. I was impressed with the ride from the airport to Cedarbrook with the professional driver, the trail back into Cedarbrook, the beauty of the hotel AND the land it is on. The check in was very low key and professional. The Adult Only lounge was inviting. A great menu, wonderful atmosphere, a pool table, very quiet. I decided on a Cheeseburger plate only to find out that they meat is hand ground, organic beef, Washington made cheese, a great bun, the fries are hand cut and cooked and the taste was unbelievably wonderful. The staff is top notch, the prices are very reasonable. The room was fantastic and the view was extremely beautiful overlooking the wetlands and being so close to the airport, I never heard an overhead plane. My entire experience at Cedarbrook Lodge was a fine experience that should be shared with others.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: Doonsy
Reviews.Content: Staying here was, simply put, a pleasure, and felt like a treat. They take really good care of you, and the facilities (guest rooms and public areas) are immaculately designed and maintained. The location is very convenient, especially if you're visiting Seattle for a relatively short trip, as it is near the Sea-Tac airport, with free shuttle service to the airport and Light Rail.

Reviews.Title: “Best night sleep ever!”
Reviews.Author: AlaskaJaybird
Reviews.Content: I stayed here two nights. Rooms are the quietest I have ever slept in. Very clean. The rooms did show a little wear in areas. The sink had a crack in it and the desk top was a little scarred up. Overall a great night of sleep, never heard a sound from anywhere else and the lodge was sold out. Loved the free snacks. They picked us up at the airport in about 20 mins both times.

Reviews.Title: “Tranquility”
Reviews.Author: rekelp2003
Reviews.Content: It is nice to stay in a hotel where the T.V. is not the focal point of the room. This place is soooo refreshing.

Reviews.Title: “This place is lovely”
Reviews.Author: Grammy Jan
Reviews.Content: Great breakfast, lovely rooms, oh those delicious snacks in each lodge!!! Quiet, beautiful grounds- what can I say? We loved this place!

Reviews.Title: “Great value!!!”
Reviews.Author: antraroony
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a lot of amenities and is a great value for the price! The only drawbacks are that there is not pool/hot tub, and the people at the front desk are not very friendly. Overall, this is a great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and quiet”
Reviews.Author: KF7DQV
Reviews.Content: Very nice relaxing. Clean with wonderful ammenities. Common areas for relaxing and a very well outfitted fitness center.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Place”
Reviews.Author: heidi_gilbert_home
Reviews.Content: We loved every minute of our stay in Cedarbrook. It is beautiful, clean - and you have no idea that you are so close to an airport. The room is a bit small - but there are ample common areas, free food, pool table and areas to walk. All for a very affordable price. The crowning event was a shirt that was inadvertantly left in the room which the staff quickly and graciously mailed to us. We would definitely go again, and told our local friends to recommend this place to anyone else that visits.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience, had a great party with friends and food service and accomodations were excellent.”
Reviews.Author: DanielWinchester
Reviews.Content: The waitstaff and service we had at dinner were the best. The wines we had with our dinner were all explained in advance of pouring and each course of dinner was described to our party. Our room was very nice and area around us was quiet. We also had a wonderful snack bar in the living room area with all items complimentary. Checkin and check-out were exemplary.

Reviews.Title: “Honey, what a great looking place to stay for a few nights in Seattle!”
Reviews.Author: Coop50
Reviews.Content: We were overnighting on the way to Florida, and when booking, we decided to stay an extra night on the way home to take in some of Seattle. The warm, wood interior and pleasant grounds looked like a great alternative to the typical presentation of a downtown hotel. And, in a residential setting, it was quiet and restful, even though just minutes from Sea-Tac International! The staff are friendly. The design is captivating. The gym is very well equipped. We loved the free snacks, continental breakfast, internet access (including computers!) and free shuttle to the airport. Parking rates for travellers leaving their car while flying are reasonable!

Reviews.Title: “Beware of and Clearly understand reservation restrictions at Cedarbrook”
Reviews.Author: OOBDC
Reviews.Content: Even though the Cedarbrook Lodge is a highly regarded Trip Advisor property, I cannot recommend it. As part of a business meeting, I had reserved a room at the Cedarbrook for February 24, 2011 via their website; the room rate was advertised as “non-refundable”. As our firm’s meeting approached a bad winter storm was forecast to hit the Seattle area on the day of our meeting. Because people were coming in from out of town (some by car over the Cascade Mountains), our company elected to postpone our meeting rather than risk weather related problems trying to host it on 2/24/11. I tried to reschedule my room reservation to another day on two occasions with different people. I was not asking to have the room costs refunded. The Lodge personnel were completely uncooperative in my request for relief on the room reservation cost even as facility after facility shut down around the Seattle area due to weather. I was charged $152.86 for a room I never used. Caveat emptor.

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable airport area hotel that doesn't feel like you are next to the airport.”
Reviews.Author: tinkat
Reviews.Content: A calm quiet property 5 minutes from SeaTac, you would not know there is an airport nearby. Beautiful grounds, comfortable rooms and a friendly staff made for a restful night.

Reviews.Title: “Your comfort is their focus”
Reviews.Author: KKC0306
Reviews.Content: Between the room amenities and special touches (books and DVDs available to borrow; snacks available both in room area and throughout meetings and included in stay; robes; accessible business center and easy in-room internet), this hotel does its best to provide everything you need for a comfortable, hassle-free stay. Really enjoyable and positive experience!

Reviews.Title: “A touch of heaven”
Reviews.Author: jandaSeattle
Reviews.Content: My young daughter and I were flying home from a lousy vacation in Mexico when our flight was delayed because of poor weather in Seattle. My friend called me and told me to try to book a hotel in Seattle because she didn't think we'd be able to make the 25 minute drive to our home. Our nightmare vacation seemed to never end, and I had no way to book a hotel because we were boarding a flight. To my surprise the airline had wireless and I was able to find out that my friend called every airport hotel and they were all booked, except for one room at the Cedarbrook lodge, so she booked it. We arrived at 3 am and the shuttle managed to pick us up in spite of the frozen, unplowed road. We were exhausted and I didn't think I could bare one more night in a bad hotel, after the disappointing trip, but to my shock, this hotel was gorgeous. I honestly (and I'm being honest here) almost wish I had saved the thousands of dollars on the disgusting Mexico (5 star) resort and just checked in a few miles from home. I could have slept a week. We snacked on fresh fruit and ice cream before bed. The rooms were so clean you could eat off the floors, as if no one had ever stepped foot into them before that day. The sheets were crisp, soft, with a big cozy comforter and my young daughter kept asking me if this was our new home...to which I answered, "yes". We slept like babies and in the morning went to the lobby for breakfast which was included in the price, and it was the best buffet breakfast I had ever seen..and I've traveled plenty. Homemade granola, hard boiled eggs, fresh juices, delicious breads. I cannot imagine even the most discriminating of travelers being disappointed in any way. I couldn't find anything to complain about and frankly I didn't think there was such a thing when it came to travel. As I write this, I realize that perhaps I should have checked in at Cedarbrook instead of booking my next trip. At least I know it is there if when I return from my long travel, I need a weekend reprieve. The only downside to this hotel, might be that it is not located in the center of Seattle. One definitely will need a car, or use public transportation to get to downtown Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “A huge hit with our kids.”
Reviews.Author: summertrip2009
Reviews.Content: My family had an overnight layover in Seattle at the end of a holiday. We booked the Cedarbrook lodge because of the great reviews on trip advisor as well as the close proximity to the airport. We LOVED this place! The service was fabulous, the rooms were clean and comfortable, the bathrooms very big with an oversized tub, the snacks in the lounge were fantastic, and we all enjoyed the breakfast the next morning. The shuttle service is 24/7 with no long waits......they come as soon as you call. Although we didn't use the fitness facilities, they looked very good. My husband and sons ate in the restaurant and said it was very good. We would definately stay here again. I think the value for the money is very good, and the airport is minutes away. The only thing that would make it better is a pool.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Getaway at Cedarbrook Lodge”
Reviews.Author: Puravidadands
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for a long weekend at Cedarbrook Lodge in early February. Having never been there, we relied on TripAdvisor reviews and were happy we did. We got a great AAA rate, which gave us three nights for the price of one, and a late checkout on our last day. However, we weren't aware there was also a complimentary upgrade to the next class of room until we actually made the reservations and got the confirmation letter where that detail was mentioned. Thus, we paid for the suite and could have paid for the smaller room and been upgraded to the suite for the same price. When we mentioned this at check-in, we were told there are only a limited number of suites and we may not have been able to get a suite if it had already been booked anyway - adding that there had been a number of inquiries into the suite. This was not a big deal, and on the plus side, they honored the credit for checked baggage where they reimburse you the cost of checked baggage (one bag for each (max two), for the flight to Seattle). The website said they would not credit the cost if combined with any other promotion (AAA), but they reimbursed us with no problem at all. I believe this promotion expires in March of this 2011. Without going into detail, we agree with the other positive reviews here....great service, comfy bed, free healthy breakfast (wonderful if you're not expecting bacon and pancakes), great view from our room, a wonderful clean gym that I want in my own home - with Life Fitness equipment and men's/women's bathroom with shower and towels and a great view while exercising. In the room, the TV is a little on the small and old side, but it worked just fine for us. Inside the room with the windows closed, we never heard any airport noise. I'm always about the bathroom, and I was pleasantly surprised to see a magnified make-up mirror, and the tub was huge (see pics). Our shuttle drivers picked us up from the airport, and shuttled us to the Lite Rail, which took us to downtown. Kudos to Tasha and Alice, who were both friendly, informative and warm. We found a few hairs and a mud smudge on the bathroom floor after housekeeping had cleaned, but we met the housekeeper and she was also warm, pleasant and friendly. A great, quiet and romantic stay at the Cedarbrook Lodge! Oh, and my brother and his wife stayed at the lodge as well. Their room was the standard room, and a bit on the small side, but our suite was quite large. All four of us hung out with a glass of wine in our room in the eve.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience - Everything It's Cracked Up To Be”
Reviews.Author: Hawkdryvr
Reviews.Content: After watching a Seattle television piece saying that the #1 Hotel in the country was "right here in Seattle" we decided that we needed to see for ourselves. The TV piece was based on Trip Advisor's feedback. We live about 100 miles away but get the Seattle TV stations. The hotel is very close to the airport but you feel like you're tucked into a secluded, wooded area far from civilization. The setting is serene and scenic. The rooms are very quiet. The common "living room" with free munchies and a fireplace was a very nice aspect. We enjoyed the Hagen Daas ice cream, sitting by the fireplace. The chips and water were tasty too. Although the hotel was nearly full on the night that we stayed.. it seemed like there was hardly anyone else there. It was great. The continental breakfast was excellent. There wasn't a huge selection of items but what was there was very nice. They had delicious bagels, the best granola that I've ever eaten with large pecans and other yummy ingredients, oatmeal, yougurt, juices, and Starbucks coffee. They also had extra ingredients to doctor your granola or oatmeal to include pecans, almonds, hazelnuts, and raisins.
