Our queen bed room was on the small size but it was very stylish, very Pacific Northwest modern. We had plenty of pillows and the bed was very comfortable. The high-speed internet was very quick and there wasn't a "process" to sign on and use it, just click on your browser and go. The hotel was typically priced for a nice, Seattle airport hotel. We paidabout $100 a night. I was surprised that it was so "reasonable." I felt it was definitely an excellent choice compared to the other national upscale chain hotels in the area that would have been at least as expensive. We loved it and will defintely stay here the next time we're in town.

Reviews.Title: “If you like pretentious snobbery, this is the place!"”
Reviews.Author: Mary6713
Reviews.Content: We love the Seattle area and travel there often. We needed a place near the airport for an early morning flight the next day. It was our anniversary so I didn't want a run-of-the-mill airport motel. The building is gorgeous. Location is convenient--if you plan to eat all meals at the lodge. The staff was aloof to the point of rude. We wanted a soft drink in our room and we were told we had to get it at the bar then offered to send it to our room. It never arrived! The next day when I ask why we could not have soft drinks in our room, the limo driver stated, "Our surveys of our clientele show that our patrons prefer HEALTHY snacks." (he did not deny the policy, nor did he apologize for our inconvenience!) The entire time we were there not one member of the staff was friendly. I kept feeling like we were not wearing the right labels. We ordered crab bisque--it was served from a small teapot-type container while the waiter mumbled about " presentation.+ The "crab" was one piece of crab balanced on a coil of leek. The bisques was poured ceremoniously around the coil of leek. COME ON! This is a LODGE, not the Whitehouse! " While we ate this lukewarm tomato soup, we were asked 4 times how it tasted! And there was nothing friendly about it. OH! and let's not forget our bar of soap--it had a hole in the center--the package said this was to eliminate the portion of the bar that is usually not used and wasted! Are you kidding me? How absolutely dumb! In one of the most beautiful areas of our country where people have for years been warm and friendly, we came away feeling like we had drifted into some strange planet of robotic idiocy. And to think we paid almost $200 for this!!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely deserved its high ratings!”
Reviews.Author: TAMARASW
Reviews.Content: I chose to stay here because of high ratings on Tripadvisor. We needed a place to stay near the airport because of an early flight out the next morning. I usually hate staying in airport hotels because they are noisy, expensive, and too utilitarian. But Cedarbrook Lodge is none of these. You would never know you were anywhere near the airport if you couldn't just barely see the airport traffic control tower over the tops of the trees. This hotel is really more of a resort...beautiful grounds and buildings that blend in with the landscaping and waterfalls. Also a very comfortable atmosphere--artwork, snacks, lounges, librairies, fitness room, etc. I could feel very at home there for days on end. It was quiet and very relaxing. It wasn't expensive, either! I was surprised at how reasonable the rates were, especially since they included free parking and internet, individual bathrobes, snacks & water bottles, newspaper, and complimentary breakfast (served in a beautiful dining room!). The beds were very comfortable--I had a great night's sleep. And this may be a silly detail to acknowledge, but I loved the throws on the end of the beds--not just a fake strip of bedspread to complete the decor, but a full-sized soft sweater-type blanket that made curling up with a book just heavenly! We only stayed one night, but I'll be sure to stay again if I ever have the opportunity. It's a pleasure to recommend Cedarbrook!

Reviews.Title: “Welcome Treats!”
Reviews.Author: Madge464
Reviews.Content: With the TripAdvisor Consumer Rating of the number 1 place to stay in the United States we could not turn down an opportunity to go away for a Birthday weekend. Arriving late we arrived tired and hungry. The setting is lovely. It is hard to believe you are in the city. The lodge is surrounded by greenspace. Our ground room floor looked out to beautiful landscape. The room is very comfortable with lush bedding and a down filled chair. On the built in desk area was the most welcoming plate of artisan cheeses, grapes, toast points, dates, and other goodies. Delicious! This pet friendly hotel had dog treats in the room as well. There are 3 buildings. Each building has a "living room" on the second floor. It is stocked with all sorts of wonderful treats available 24/7. The complimentary breakfast was filled with local treats such as smoked salmon, steel cut oatmeal, bagels, and salami made in the area. I will not stay anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Nicest place to stay near SEATAC”
Reviews.Author: DebR_AK89
Reviews.Content: Wonderful ambience, very quiet and peaceful, and the atmosphere enfolds you. I had a wonderful one night stay - sorry to leave! The breakfast buffet was beautifully laid out & delicious. The dining area was spacious & upscale. Overall a perfect lodging experience.

Reviews.Title: “Nice property but not up to expectaions”
Reviews.Author: Steve_mcn
Reviews.Content: Based on the glowing reviews here, my expectations were pretty high. So based on that, and my experience on a rainy Saturday night, I have to give this hotel an average rating. First, the layout of the property is such that we had to walk at least 100 yards in the rain, from the parking lot to the entrance of the building where the room was. This might reflect the legacy of the property as a conference center, but that felt very unwelcoming. The room was the best part of the stay. Nice and large, but had an old TV. My wife enjoyed the large tub. The beds were very comfortable. Amenities were as expected in a nice hotel. And quiet, given the proximity to SeaTac airport. Service was nothing to write home about, adequate. Their 'living room' with the free snacks was ok, malted milk balls, yogurt, cheese sticks, ice cream, some sad oranges. Nice, but not exceptional. Because I booked through Expedia, they did not reward the Stash Hotel points that I just signed up for. OK, I get that, but to book through them for the same room would have cost $40 more. Didn't seem worth it. Because we could not get a reservation into their rave restaurant, we decided to eat instead at the lounge. The food was good, not exceptional. And while we were in the lounge, adjacent to the restaurant, I kept looking over to see empty table after empty table in the restaurant. So that spoke to poor management of their space. So overall, nice place, ...but not exceptional

Reviews.Title: “Simply Superb”
Reviews.Author: tinkerbell-hop
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the beautiful Cedarbrook Lodge for our 25th wedding anniversary was simply superb, and we plan to return. Special kudos to John, at the Copperleaf Restaurant, for serving-up memories and an anniversary/Valentine's Day meal that was simply sublime.

Reviews.Title: “Disneyland here we come, great place to stay before we fly!”
Reviews.Author: Moname58
Reviews.Content: We were taking our grandchildren to Disneyland. Needed a room for the night before our flight. Went to my favorite spot for hotel rooms and Cedarbrook Lodge was the one choosen. What a great place to stay, beautiful grounds, away from the street, so very peaceful. They offer a lot of extra's that do not come standard at other hotels. The boy's really enjoyed the candy bar, ice cream and yogut that was available in the livingroom for all to enjoy. Would love to come back with my Sister's for a girl's weekend, would be a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “An unexpected gem at the airport.”
Reviews.Author: spk78
Reviews.Content: From the welcome upon arrival through checkout the staff was very friendly. The grounds were very well done. The "living rooms" were a great place to sit, relax, enjoy a free snack, and visit with friends. The rooms were comfortable and roomy. We could sit in the lounge or restaurant looking out the large windows to the west and not even notice the airport just past the trees. This is a large step above the usual airport hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like a Queen, queit no outside noise, awsome beds, food to die for and even for your loved puppy.”
Reviews.Author: Taz40kia
Reviews.Content: I was very surprised how beautiful the grounds were and the rooms just like home. I saw thch is hotel on KOMO 4 and it cought my eye. A family room open 24 hours and free snacks. If you are looking for a quick stop be for or after a flight this is the place to be. It is so quiet in the room that we never heard a plane or the storm the blew through the nigth we were there. This is the first place that I have stayed were if you pulled the shad over the window that you were in your own world. The beds are awsome and pillows they know that we like to sleep with more than 1 or 2 flat pillows. The beds have 4+ full, fluffy pillows on each bed. The food was great and very filling. Room service hours could have been longer, but they made an exception as the dinner was still full and alowed use to order via roomsevice. No fighting with ice mechines they have it baged an ready to go right out of the freezer. The grounds are well you will have to wait till I see them in spring time. I am sure that they will be awsome. The next large gathering I am in charge of I am going to use this facility. So give it a try they have great rates and I am sure you will find this is truly a hidden pleasure in the Seatac area.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Lodge, very tranquil”
Reviews.Author: chrisdawg99
Reviews.Content: I booked a Valentine's Day Weekend getaway based on other reviews of Cedarbrook, and based on the high rating they received from Tripadvisor. I agree with the reviewers who were impressed, but I would suggest managing your expectations. Cedarbrook Lodge is beautiful, but for those expecting top-shelf opulent luxury, you may be disappointed. Cedarbrook is very "northwest-ey" in it's architecture, style, personality, and comfort. If your expectations are sufficiently set, you will be pleased. The rooms were comfortable and spacious, the beds were wonderful. The hotel staff was pleasant but seemed young and inexperienced at times. When checking out, they had trouble fixing errors that were made in my final bill. I expected more from a top-tier boutique hotel. The facilities and amenities at Cedarbrook are pleasant, but limited. Aside from a fantastic restaurant (Copperleaf), a small bar, and a large workout room, there isn't much to do aside from relax. However the hotel is so close to local shops, movie theaters, and restaurants, that is hardly a problem. The grounds were beautiful as well, but rustic and not highly manicured. If I had to gripe, I would point out that there was some trash in the landscaping, and that we clearly saw a "working girl" on her way out in the morning with her "companion". However these minor issues aside, it is a great hotel and wonderful place to relax.

Reviews.Title: “Our high expectations were met, and exceeded in very way!”
Reviews.Author: dchoffman
Reviews.Content: After reading the glowing reviews on TripAdvisor.com and that they earned the #1 spot for domestic hotels, I wanted to check out Cedarbrook Lodge. I booked a room for the Saturday before Valentine's Day. Given the holiday weekend, and the recent press, my expectations were somewhat lowered. My wife and I were in for a very nice surprise. Members of the staff, to a person, were very welcoming and helpful. The communal "living rooms" were always well stocked with everything we needed/wanted, while the rooms were cozy, and well appointed. Knowing that this was a former corporate retreat helped us understand the size of the guest rooms. Our only dissappointment came when we went to the bar to play pool. The billiards table is setup in the center of the rather small bar area with no room for the cue while you're taking a shot. The close proximity to other patron's, who are enjoying their meals/drinks, made us give up and return to our room before we even entered the bar. This is literally the only complaint we had. The continental breakfast was spectacular. The bed was comfortable, the property laid out well, and the overall ambiance calming. Exactly what we needed for a one night retreat.

Reviews.Title: “Restful weekend”
Reviews.Author: mcstacyKirkland_WA
Reviews.Content: We totally enjoyed our stay at Cedarbrook Lodge. Staff was pleasant, grounds and room were serene. We ate at the bar the first night and had excellent food. Lots to do nearby. Would certainly go back for a restful getaway, it is very pleasant there! Very near the airport but we did not hear airplanes.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel EVER - gracious, warm, welcoming”
Reviews.Author: kikiruns
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in some very nice hotels, including the Four Seasons and Bellagio - This hotel beats both hands down. It is beautiful, set among beautiful greenery, and yet less than 5 minutes from the airport! When we walked in, we had been up for about 36 hours or so having flown in from Hawaii on the red-eye, busy all day, and freezing cold. We were graciously greeted, provided with a quick check-in and advised of the amenities which include a living room with a fire place (with a fire going), snacks (no charge), a stocked refrigerator and bottled water in every building. It was such a comfort to us after such a long, cold, tiring day. The room was a little small, but also beautiful, and the bed and linens so comfy - Slept very soundly. In the morning, had complimentary breakfast which was perfect. I will ALWAYS stay here anytime I visit Seattle - It's worth the trip into town - seriously!

Reviews.Title: “A mountain lodge in the city.”
Reviews.Author: Commissioner43
Reviews.Content: I was drawn to the lodge the first time by the free parking; the beauty and value keep me coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Rustic, clean.”
Reviews.Author: SeattleHotelie
Reviews.Content: Nice, basic - "rustic" hotel for conferences near Seattle Airport (Seatac). Very clean rooms, bed was very hard and uncomfortable. Would recommend for meetings, the workout room, break rooms were nice. Wifi was very spotty in most locations. Restaurant was very good but pricey. Rooms were very basic, low key.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice...will stay there again”
Reviews.Author: tabb7118
Reviews.Content: Cedarbrook came with giant credentials, so our expectations were high. I expected ultra-luxury, but that was not the case. The rooms were small but well designed. The level of decor and functionality was very high. The rooms were clean and odor-free. Televisions were small. Its former life as a corporate retreat center was obvious everywhere. The wooded setting is beautiful...nice woodsy views out of every window. The desk staff were young and efficient. We didn't eat in the restaurant, but we enjoyed the morning free breakfast, which was spare and on the granola side. We had an advance-purchase, no-cancel rate, which worked out to about $108 per nite with tax. The parking was free, but it can turn out to be a loooong way from the entry door to your building. Each building has a "living room" with television and sitting area and complimentary snacks...nice touch. The fitness center appeared to be sstate of the art and very large. This is a very nice hotel...but it's a stretch to call it one of the best in the world.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel is great but the Copperleaf Restaurant Dining Experience made it over the top!”
Reviews.Author: ruyama
Reviews.Content: The rooms are nice, clean, well appointed (except for the small tv), two desks, comfortable beds, nice roomy bathroom, set in a Scandinavian/European style. But, who would have thunk you could get a 5 star dining experience. Chef Mark Godinet and Culinary Director Roy Breiman have done a magnificent job in bringing an incredible dining experience in a relaxed, lodge setting. We had an amazing six course dinner with each course paired thoughtfully with the perfect glass of wine (using the best from local wineries), starting with the seared foie gras (unbelievably awesome), seared diver scallops (perfectly carmelized) with house cured prosciutto, black cod (with perfectly crisped skin) with house cured bacon, and slow braised (10 hours, I was told) short ribs. Everything was perfect. We were told that Chef Mark was the protein chef at Napa Valley's famous French Laundry and every bit of that dinner was as good, if not better, at a fraction of the cost and none of the California pretentiousness we hate. We will definitely make it back here again. It was our pleasure to be guests there and are hats are off to Chef Mark, Roy, our host, Kendall, and server, Adam, to an unexpectedly wonderful dining experience.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely!”
Reviews.Author: AKMissy
Reviews.Content: The rooms, common areas, and the grounds are all just lovely. The staff was friendly and helpful, without exception. The complementary continental breakfast buffet was good; far better than what you get at most places. The location can't be beat; 5 minutes from the airport, plus they provide a free shuttle to and from the light-rail station which takes you right downtown quickly and inexpensively. We'll definitely stay here again when visiting Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “A Very good airport hotel/lodge, not so good for down-town exploring”
Reviews.Author: Travellerisrael
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 2 nights coming and going into and from Sea-Tec airport. Pros: 1. Close to the airport 2. Very nice ambience - really like a country lodge, very surprising to find in that area 3. good rooms. 4. excellent gym. 5. very good (yet expensive) restaurant. Cons 1. location - if you don't have your own transportation and not just using this hotel for airport accommodation this is not a very good spot for travelling around Seattle. Getting into down-town requires a shuttle from the hotel to the link light rail station and then 40 minutes ride down-town. getting back requires the same journey, only you have to wait for about 20 minutes from the time you call the shuttle till the time it picks you up (it's a 3 minutes ride). staying down town is much better (and the price is not so different). 2. maintenance - I had all kind of annoying issues in my room - leaking faucets, TV channels not working and so on, nothing serious but you would expect better from a hotel that level. all in all - a good hotel, not really suitable for tourists seeking to travel in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome - Great rooms, great service, great comfort”
Reviews.Author: Francois000
Reviews.Content: Flew from Europe to Seattle for the first time in Juanuary this year, it was for 1 day business + 2 days leisure. I made my choice based on N°1 Tripadvisor rating of the Seatac area. Hotel was close to my meeting, and the free shuttle services were perfect for the Airport and for going to the Light Rail station to go downtown (when coming back you simply phone and they pick you up). Most comfortable rooms ever for the "jet lagged" traveller, with a great sense of details: possibility to get a real darkness during the day, great bed, not forgetting the cable internet. Breakfast box at any time of the night, good restaurant, and absolutly NO noise. Huge lobbies with kitchen and free snacks, very relaxing coaches... this level of service was new for me, even in 4 stars hotel. A must go

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ArtinForestFalls
Reviews.Content: Simply fantastic in every way. Very close to Sea-Tac but quiet as it is east of the airport and the planes travel north-south

Reviews.Title: “I would stay nowhere else in Seatac”
Reviews.Author: Olyfoodlover13
Reviews.Content: I've been to this location twice as an extraordinarily well-designed business venue. Near the airport, easy to find, CRAZY good value, wonderful service, great food. If you can afford Doubletree or the Radisson or the Holiday Inn, you're in for a serious treat.

Reviews.Title: “Very pretty place, lodge feeling. Great service.”
Reviews.Author: athurkow
Reviews.Content: The only way I could afford staying here was with a half price deal. It is a very nice place. The restaurant was expensive and had small artsy portions. The cheese plate was the strongest cheese ever and wasn't pleasant- this coming from a person who hasn't met a cheese she doesn't like, but I met 'em here. The main dinner was tasty and I guess for fancy dinners or special occasions this would be a great place to go. The servers were all very nice and the atmosphere was warm in the cold winter. The rooms were small but elegant and the big bathtub was relaxing. Overall a great place to stay if you can afford it!

Reviews.Title: “This place is a joke”
Reviews.Author: FormerTravelWriter55
Reviews.Content: I'm wondering what Cedarbrook the other reviewers stayed in. We reserved a "suite" that was only one room, unless you counted the foyer. It had no desk, no towel racks, no light switches accessible from the bed, no bell staff, no luggage carts (when we checked in). The refrigerator was on the floor, so you had to kneel to put anything in. One of the lights wouldn't go off because it had both a dimmer and a hidden toggle switch. The food in the living rooms never changed (who wants candy for breakfast?). There were oranges, but nothing to peel them with. You had to use your key every time you went from building to building. We had a cocktail party in our suite, and had to go outside to let every single guest in! It was a joke from start to finish.

Reviews.Title: “Full length bedroom window to the woods-resort style lodge-24 hour snacks-5 minute ride to Seattle airport”
Reviews.Author: Marcia35
Reviews.Content: Already recommended it to all of my friends on Facebook...used it as a relaxing place to spend a layover and enjoyed it enough I'm trying to think of reasons to go to Seattle to spend more time there...

Reviews.Title: “Wow”
Reviews.Author: adrian1059
Reviews.Content: I looked on Tripadvisor for a hotel near Seatac and the other reviews are absolutely correct: Don't even bother with the other Seatac hotels. This is the one you should stay in. I stayed 1 night at the Cedarbrook Lodge and wish I organized my trip to stay longer! A very cozy hotel. I spent most of the night sitting in the common area/library munching on the free snacks (chips, candy, ice cream, tea) and reading my book. I great relaxing way to spend an evening before a flight. Great rooms with comfortable beds. The only thing I can fault is that they don't offer king beds. There was free continental breakfast but I didn't get to try it as I had to be at the airport. The complimentary shuttle left at the hotel lobby and is very close to the airport. If you want a good, relaxing night before a flight, this is your place!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding all around”
Reviews.Author: Martins_Montrose
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travel frequently for leisure, and Cedarbrook Lodge is one of the best hotels we have ever experienced. They are a ten minute drive from Seatac airport - they offer a free shuttle to and from the airport. The staff is very professional and service all around is excellent. We dined at the Copperleaf Restaurant and were very pleased with the service and food quality. There is an emphasis on local food and drink, which we appreciate since one of the main reasons we travel is for the "foodie" experience. The free breakfast buffet is without a doubt the BEST we have ever had the pleasure of enjoying. Items offered include house-made granola with dried fruit, hazelnuts, and almonds; smoked salmon; an assortment of breads, rolls, and bagels; boiled eggs; oatmeal; cold cereal; coffee, juices, hot cider, hot cocoa, and my favorite (and not a cheap item, either!) - a selection of Mighty Leaf teas! While we were walking the outdoor paths along the protected wetlands area, we saw a few garden beds and several fig trees - we were later told that the restaurant grows some of its own fruit, vegetables and herbs. The landscaping is beautiful; we enjoyed just being outdoors and were amazed at how clean and crisp the air is, even though the hotel is close to an airport. We stayed in one of the suites with a fireplace. It was more spacious than we expected, and very clean. Each building has a common area with a fireplace and free snacks such as potato chips, malted milk balls, yogurt, string cheese, bottled water (usually NOT free at hotels!), and mini containers of Haagen Dazs. We received an incredible deal as AAA members (about 2/3 off regular price for staying 3 nights), so I hope that they continue offering AAA discounts. We will certainly return to Cedarbrook when we visit Seattle. The value for the price is hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “Will never stay anywhere else when flying out of Sea-Tac”
Reviews.Author: walkingaftermidnight
Reviews.Content: What a find. Cedarbrook Lodge was the perfect way to begin and end our family vacation flying out of Sea-Tac. Dinner in the restaurant was exquisite. The staff could not have been more helpful - even having fresh coffee ready for us to take on their free shuttle at tto the airport 4:00AM. On our return we had time to enjoy the Continenatal breakfast; it was superb. Room are spacious and beautifully appointed. And then there are the special treats in the common area... We won't spoil that surprise!

Reviews.Title: “Skip all other "near the airport" hotels!”
Reviews.Author: DameJudith
Reviews.Content: Saw a print ad on this property and, wanting something "nice" for a change AND convenient for our next-morning flight out of SEA-TAC, booked it for our only night in Seattle. Although it's definitely a place that can and does cater to groups, I recommend it highly as a most excellent respite for any traveler's long travel day experience. Didn't try the restaurant, but the bar menu was varied and delish. The accommodations were top of the line and not "shop-worn" as are so many of the usual airport-adjacent hotels. BTW: it really is easy to navigate to the airport from there.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Papergal
Reviews.Content: This was my second visit to Cedarbrook Lodge and this visit was every bit as good as the first visit. The atmosphere of the hotel and grounds is beautiful and calming. Customer service is excellent. Airport shuttle service was prompt and comfortable. Fitness room was well equipped, spacious and clean. Loved the convenience of the complimentary snacks in the living room. I would plan to stay at this hotel on my next trip to Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable hotel! One of the best ever.”
Reviews.Author: bettibiz
Reviews.Content: Amazing. My husband and I stayed here the last night of our 25th anniversary trip, and it was his favorite hotel of the trip (including the Ritz-Carlton in Orlando). The hotel itself has a very Northwest feel – huge high-beamed ceilings, lots of open space, and a committed effort to being green. It sits on 18 acres of reclaimed wetlands 10 minutes from the airport, and features a reflection pool, walking paths, and the requisite workout room. The lobby is stunning because it overlooks the restaurant, which is absolutely gorgeous. Hotel shuttle is free (as is the shuttle to the mall), and I loved that we were in a Flex rather than the traditional big van – it felt much more personal. Check-in was a breeze, and our room was fabulous. For $164, we got a large suite with a queen bed, sitting area, and fireplace. On each floor, there is a lounge, open 24/7, with a fireplace, small library, seating area, and two refrigerators: a small one with water and pop in it, and a large one with snacks (string cheese, yogurt in various flavors). There were also snacks sitting out on the counter – various chocolates and potato chips. Whenever possible, the food is local and organic; all the wines on the menu are Washington wines. Remaining foods are typically organic and fair trade, including the coffee. The toiletries are PABA-free and in recycled (and recyclable) bottles. The room, and the grounds, were wonderfully quiet. Breakfast was excellent, with FRESH bagels and pastries as well as a variety of hot foods and cereals. The breakfast room was also quiet – the whole hotel was simply a relaxing place to be. My one – very small – complaint is that housekeeping wasn’t totally thorough. I dropped a pen behind the cushion on the bench in our room, and when I went to retrieve it, there were gummy bears and other detritus back there; it clearly hadn’t been cleaned in a while. However, the rest of the room was clean and well-maintained, the furniture was high-quality and the bed (and pillows) were ahhhhhhhh…so comfortable. One word of warning: no high-def television. It didn’t matter to me, but I know it does to some. I would stay here again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Far above our expectations!!!”
Reviews.Author: stanswife
Reviews.Content: Cedarbrook is one of those places that is so wonderfully unexpected and you can hardly wait to return. everyone there was friendly and helpful and made our stay so comfortable. It was clean beyond -the grounds were so well groomed and the landscaping lovely, the restraunt and bar were wonderful, the morning breakfast was a delight with offerings of fabulous food-even salmon!

Reviews.Title: “This is the place to enjoy an outstanding chef and very pleasant staff.”
Reviews.Author: 6216Worldtraveler
Reviews.Content: Our small room was clean and very comfortable.Next tiime we will get one of the two junior suites.The entire staff was friendly and the chef is outstanding. He uses local farmers market ingrediants and does an exceptional job with tastes and presentations. We enjoyed the free continental breakfast with hot oatmeal and plenty of Starbuck's coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Not your "Typical" hotel!”
Reviews.Author: DianenAlan
Reviews.Content: While searching for a place to stay nearby relatives we were visiting for the holidays, we found a "buy one get one" deal offered by this hotel! Despite it's proximity to the airport, it offered quiet, secluded & comfortable accommodations! The room was very clean and modern, with a view of tranquil surroundings; the bed very comfortable. Robes and newspapers were complimentary! It was just what we needed at the end of each day, as a retreat from the holiday hustle-bustle! Breakfast was included, somewhat different from the norm & served in the "lodge" which featured a beautiful common area & restaurant/bar, complete with a working fireplace. If they could have controlled the weather, it would have been perfect! Would recommend for short or long term stay!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: tucumcari
Reviews.Content: Everything was perfect. We will definitely return!!!

Reviews.Title: “I would book a flight to Seattle from Hawaii, just to stay at Cedarbrook Lodge!”
Reviews.Author: n0nfrequentflyer
Reviews.Content: Honestly, I hope this place continues to be in business for years and years to come. It was the BEST hotel my husband and I have stayed at (especially for the price) and we would come back to Seattle just to stay again. From the moment you check in, the staff, pleasant and welcoming, is all about the guest's comfort. As other reviewers have stated, the free snacks are a nice touch (especially since we forgot to buy our bottled water when we got to the city). The rooms are nice and big, the extra large desk area is a very nice touch for people with computers and the oversized soaking tub was unexpected. We arrived on New Year's Eve, ate at the restaurant. Our sever, Niecy, was knowledgeable and extremely polite. The bartender, Joey, recommended a very nice beer for my husband and the other wait staff were very friendly. I honestly hope guests continue to respect this place. I can see people taking advantage of the hospitality this place offers (taking more free food, water, etc. than one could possibly consume). I didn't see anyone doing that, but I can see it being a problem. My only complaint, if I had one, would be that I miss not having a fridge in the room. If you have something you need to keep cold (like the homemade cheeses we bought to take home from Beechers), you would have to keep it in the community fridge (no thank you). So I got some ice and made my own "fridge" in the room. It worked. :) My only other complaint would be that we couldn't stay longer! I can't believe this place! It's NOT what I expected and it's so close to the airport. We will return soon, I promise!

Reviews.Title: “Serenity and Beauty in the middle of Sea Tac”
Reviews.Author: emmaglass
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Lodge both last Christmas and this one. They offer a 21 day advanced reservation discount and a serene stay in a surprising spot of hidden beauty near SeaTac airport. The Lodge style architecture of the building is also very beautiful with floor to ceiling vistas in the dining room and fireplace room. The highest quality materials are present along with exquisite attention to detail and a view of a wetlands outside. The rooms are spacious with huge bathrooms, all spotlessly clean and artfully appointed. We love this place and wish I could find more excuses to stay. A huge bonus is that it is pet friendly as well.

Reviews.Title: “A peaceful retreat near SEATAC Airport in Seattle with a First Class restaurant--Copperleaf!”
Reviews.Author: dwulkan
Reviews.Content: The rooms are Northwest styled with a warm atmospherics. They are clean, functional, and geared for the business traveller. We especially liked the desk set up which was great for computing and the bathroom was large with an oversized bath. But we came for the dinner at Copperleaf which was fabulous. the food here is fresh, from local farms, and "sustainable". the flavors are subtle and unique, the presentations and combinations are creative. This restaurant is first class in food and service. Not your ordinary hotel restaurant--it's a hidden gem and a culinary delight! We have dined here three times in the past 2 months (fall of 2010), and each time the culinary experience was superb.

Reviews.Title: “Cedarbrook Lodge is Head and Shoulders above other Airport Hotels”
Reviews.Author: luvs2roam
Reviews.Content: We loved this place as a base on the first and last night of our coveted vacation. It is, as many have commented, extremely quiet, considering the proximity to Seatac airport. The property is beautifully landscaped and surrounded by trees. The buildings are strikingly designed. We loved the interesting art thoughout the complex. The thing that we enjoyed the most, though, was the food. At this point I'd like to advise you that if you want to eat in the restaurant- do make a reservation in advance, or you may be dissapointed. On the first night we stayed, we ate our meal in the bar. I really enjoyed the sampling of locally brewed beers. What a treat. The last night of our trip was Christmas Eve, and the great room was beautifully decorated. Our Christmas Eve dinner was superb. The gorgeous, creative and delicious meals, really provided a terrific finish to our holiday. We loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Based on other reviews had high expectations, but they were exceded”
Reviews.Author: aeiny
Reviews.Content: Spent a week here while on a family trip to Seattle. Superb, relaxing, accommodation close to light rail stations for easy (30 minute) access the city (note: park & ride lot at International Blvd very busy, better to use hotel shuttle). Former private conference center for bank explains unique architecture and larger than average rooms. Continental style buffet breakfast very good. Lunch and dinner menu not extensive (probably not young family friendly) but top quality food and service. Unless you particularly want to be down-town, this would be hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Oasis”
Reviews.Author: DawnPowellRiver
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in quiet location very close to SeaTac airport. Our son was flying out of SEATAC for the holidays and we drove him down from Vancouver and choice Cedarbrook based on reviews. We loved the "livingroom concept" and my son and husband watched the game while we snacked on the free ice cream and chips. Hotel grounds are beautiful but you are isolated - but we had our car and they will shuttle you to the incredible near by shopping mall/box stores, the airport and transit. The rooms are not fancy and are a bit Dorm Like - Restaurant for dinner is pricey but very good - ask for a table by the fire if you don't like bench seating. We ate at South Centre the next evening (Outbacks) where all the food chain restaurants are. We also went downtown for the afternoon and took the Underground Tour of Seattle (very interesting) and a nice break from the Christmas shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: Internati0nalist
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Cedarbrook Lodge on my way to see an unwell relation. As soon as you enter the hotel with its natural wood beams it has a definite wow factor and I was told I was not the first to vocalise my appreciation! Amazingly the staff remembered me on my return visit just two weeks later and it was like returning home. Cliched maybe but true. Very welcome too given the stressful nature of my visit. The restaurant was relaxing and excellent food quality with customers clearly not associated with the hotel visiting as well which reflects its quality of food and popularity. I will certainly be returning to stay there when next in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “A quiet oasis away from the hustle and bustle!!!”
Reviews.Author: Cb1180
Reviews.Content: Given it's proximity to everything fun and exciting in the Seattle/Tacoma area and the fact its less than 2 miles from the airport, I was extremely suprised at the level of amenities and the quietness of the Lodge. From the moment we drove on the property it seemed as though we were at a secluded resort somewhere. The staff was friendly and welcoming from check-in to check-out. They have free parking which is a rarity and in addition they offer 24-7 snacks (loved the white chocolate covered pretzels), breakfast and free wifi! As for the rooms, we stayed in a double queen room which was very long and not very wide. However it didn't really feel cramped and there was lots of storage space for clothes, as well as a very long desk/counter areas to put things on. The tv was positioned off to the right, next to the window which made it a little awkward for viewing, but we weren't in Seattle for the tv so it was more than adequate. The only negative was that the people above us moved like a heard of elephants on the second night we were there - it sounded like small children running around. That was really the only noise we heard while in the room. The food in the restaurant was pricey but very good. We were the only ones eating there and the staff was very informative and attentive during our dining experience.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful and by the airport!”
Reviews.Author: moru4ia
Reviews.Content: luxury at the airport! this is a gem...do not pass up the opportunity to rest in a safe wonderful environment! this place will ruin you for life regarding a stay at the airport hotels! it is so luxurious and wonderful and beside the airport! you can not beat the value. I did get a great deal! thank you for the experience! The view of the ravine and the bar and decor can not be beat! lovely!

Reviews.Title: “Eco-friendly elegance”
Reviews.Author: Scott_R60
Reviews.Content: Cedarbrook Lodge was a very pleasant surprise! It is truly one of the cleanest and most stylish hotels I have stayed in! (Plus they are super eco-friendly too!) The staff was superb and every aspect of this hotel spoke of the highest attention to detail and focus on quality. I highly recommend this hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not like any airport hotel I've ever seen”
Reviews.Author: Nancy1962
Reviews.Content: Cedarbrook Lodge is a respite for the traveler between layovers at Sea-Tac airport. The Lodge is on several rolling landscaped acres giving you a feel for the Northwest. You don't hear the plane traffic and feel like you are in the woods. The complimentary airport shuttle is efficient on the half hour and takes only 10 minutes. This is still used as a business/retreat center but for the traveler it has excellent dining and a nice bar complete with a pool table. The continental breakfast is served in a lovely room and has many choices. The rooms are more expensive than the usual airport hotel, but the ambience is worth it for a special trip.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful NW Style Hotel Convenient to Airport and Light Rail”
Reviews.Author: 1happygal
Reviews.Content: Just stayed one night--in preparation for returning back east. Very comfortable hotel. Comfortable luxurious room at a great price with 21 day advance purchase. Natural location with more of a campus than hotel feel. Complimentary grab & go snack bar for late arrivers or early leavers or just hungry folks! I would definitely stay there again when I visit Seattle--although Ididn't use it, they have a free shuttle to the airport or light rail for easy access into town. I have already recommended to friends and family. Hope I have more than just a 12 hour stay next time!

Reviews.Title: “Every hotel should be this nice!”
Reviews.Author: amandaj0808
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled from Ohio to the area for the first time with a couple of our friends. We found a great deal on hotels.com for Cedarbrook Lodge after reading the reviews on tripadvisor. Cedarbrook is awesome. The staff was friendly and helpful. The amenities are great, -what other hotel can you just walk into after a long day and grab a bottle of water and a snack for free? No where I've ever been. The location is perfect, -close to the airport (and they have free shuttle service) and it's really close to downtown Seattle. The atmosphere is wonderful. It's quite, peaceful, clean and absolutely beautiful. In all honesty, the only disappointment was having to come home. Thanks, Cedarbrook Lodge and Seattle for a great trip! We'll definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “The reviews don't lie, this place is fantastic!!!!”
Reviews.Author: 1travel10125
Reviews.Content: Great location. Very close to SeaTac airport, but you would think you are in the country. Only about a 15 minute drive to downtown Seattle. I chose this hotel based on previous reviews and was not disappointed. It was even better than I expected.

Reviews.Title: “Totally blown away!”
Reviews.Author: iGrok
Reviews.Content: The only surprises at Cedarbrook Lodge were pleasant ones! My partner and I were continuously amazed at the amenities and staff. This place feels more like a retreat or a healing get-away. Very quiet considering it's handy location. The Main Building was very impressive and even the basic rooms were very nicely appointed. We Will be visiting again!

Reviews.Title: “Oasis in an urban jungle”
Reviews.Author: thesnowbirds
Reviews.Content: I tripped upon this hotel while looking for something in or around the Seattle area. WOW! WOW! What a haven.We loved it from the moment we drove up.Not your run of the mill hotel,to say the lest. Grounds-call you to come walk about! Deco,loved it! Beds and pillows,AWESOME!! Food and snacks-GREAT! Overall,I am there next time we are in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing was less than Perfect”
Reviews.Author: MidwestMom58
Reviews.Content: There was freezing rain in Seattle so not wanting to drive on the icy roads I booked this hotel in-flight using internet reviews. The shuttle picked me up within 5 minutes of my phone call. At the hotel I was graciously allowed to check in early. It was fabulous to be able to begin to "just unwind " after being up since 3:20 a.m. midwest time. As I walked about the hotel and the grounds the peaceful setting and ambience was very relaxing. Bottled water and fruit and snacks were available right in the "living rooms" at no charge so getting some much needed hydration and energy was so unbelievably simple - it should be this way everywhere. The coffee iand tea selection in the room was top-of-the-line. The breakfast buffet was the best I ever had anywhere. I didn't use the shuttle to the shopping center or the amtrak station in tukwilla but I tucked that information away in my mind for my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Tucked away but close to everything”
Reviews.Author: boisewells
Reviews.Content: Extremely helpful front desk and waitstaff. Room and bathroom were very clean, tastefully decorated. Huge windows. Lots of storage and lighting. Loved the entire property. Located close to SeaTac and the faint rumble of the jets, but a very quiet stay. Living rooms were awesome with all the free snacks. Best robe ever! We will make this our first choice for staying in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like an honored guest!”
Reviews.Author: zcathy
Reviews.Content: While visiting, I kept thinking "I have to tell ____ about this, they'd love it" Over and over again. Multiple friends, multiple reasons. Lovely architecture, comfortable rooms, fabulous complimentary breakfast including delicious protein (hard boiled eggs, capers, salami, salmon), ice cream in the living rooms for my husband's late night snack, great fitness center for me to counteract the ice cream, superior service... I'm now looking for a reason to go back, just because!

Reviews.Title: “Not what I had expected!”
Reviews.Author: Traveling-Kathy
Reviews.Content: We had to spend 3 days in Seattle for my husbands MotorTrike classes. They are not available where we live. Because of impending snow and my total disappointment with the hotel we left a day early. The hotel was nice enough but from recent experience I would not say it was worth the previous guests ratings. The room was adequate and the bathroom was nice. We even enjoyed the living-room and the snacks, but the breakfast left a lot to be desired. If you weren't in the mood for oatmeal or bagels the selection was very limited. The bread and danish were stale and only one flavor of jam was available. There were two types of cold cereal, salami, salmon and hard boiled eggs. What I didn't find was any kind of cheese (oh I forgot there was cream cheese). The bedding was nice but the bed felt kind of small and the towels in the bathroom were hung under the sink. I asked for a Sunday paper and was told they didn't come.

Reviews.Title: “A lush hideaway.”
Reviews.Author: misterapollo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four days and were very impressed by this hotel. The greenery, ponds and landscape were lovely, even in the very cold and wet November weather. Our room was great and looked out on the wetland that almost entirely blocks the airport from view. Generous amenities and natural toiletries including facial cleanser and bath salts. We ate at the bar once and in the restaurant at lunch, both were delicious with great atmosphere and service. As others have said the breakfast spread is amazing--with gourmet granola, fresh baked pastries and mighty leaf tea in addition to other delicacies. We also enjoyed the fitness center which has top notch machines and mats, as well as water, lockers and showers. It was difficult to motivate ourselves to leave this cozy paradise and go out and sight see! We relied on the courtesy shuttles to get around--just know that they leave the lodge about every half hour and it's a good idea to call ahead if you know when you want to leave. FYI: the only think that is not streamlined here is the late checkout benefit with some packages, we had someone knocking at our door three hours early and then our keys stopped working two hours before we were supposed to check out. Except for this glitch, this hotel is a gem and we will stay here again without hesitation!

Reviews.Title: “Family with young kids, beautiful overnight stay, wish we could stay longer.”
Reviews.Author: LolaSanFrancisco-7
Reviews.Content: We read some great reviews and decided to book because we had a lay-over, flying out the very next day. This place was CRAZY! As soon as we were pick-up from the Seattle airport curbside. Mike picked us up and was so gracious. We have two children, 10 months/ 5 years. We got to the hotel- WOW. It is beautiful. Really. The lobby was spectacular, the grounds- beautifully kept. I cannot believe we scored with such a great price. Just don't bother looking anywhere else. Book this place, you won't be disappointed. The rooms are very cozy, clean, modern and beautiful views. Excellent yummy food in the 'living room'. My 5 year old loved the string cheese. Oh- must mention the bar, a very cool place to hang out. We would have been there if we were traveling solo (with no kiddos). Breakfast- hmm... really, my husband and i couldn't believe how nice it was. Smoked Salmon, fresh figs/ prosciutto. Of course it also had all the basic continental breakfast items as well. This was a superb way to start our day. I use reviews all the time to help plan our trips. I really wanted to make a point to contribute to this one. It was truly exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “WOW...prepare to feel like VIP - even if you are not!”
Reviews.Author: brewer10
Reviews.Content: Beautiful location. Quiet, serene and secluded feeling. The chef is outstanding...ability to make the simplest thing look and taste gourmet! I can't wait to return to dine as well as stay over again. I have traveled many places, never stayed where they had 24 snacks available for FREE! Pretty amazing service in this day of economic turmoil... Book your personal stay OR wow your business associates with this destination for your next conference!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel near Airport”
Reviews.Author: justmelvz
Reviews.Content: I love the lodge! This was the second time that I've stayed here. We have an 8 month old and they supplied a pack n play. The lodge is quiet, comfortable, and has large bathrooms. There are free treats in the "living room" area of each building like malt balls, string cheese, ice cream, and other goodies. The comp breakfast is ok but not great, but the room service is very good.

Reviews.Title: “The Most Amazing Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lady_World_Traveller
Reviews.Content: The website of the Cedarbrook Lodge does not do it justice. This is a gorgeous hotel, with beautiful landscaped property. We like to sleep with the window open, and heard some faint noise from planes, but otherwise you would never know this serene hotel is minutes from the airport. There is a free shuttle from the airport plus they will shuttle you to the large, nearby mall. The only thing negative thing I would want people to know is that if you have mobility issues, you may want to stay elsewhere; there is a fair bit of walking to get around the property. There is no one to handle luggage and it was a bit difficult to get our luggage from our car to our room as they only have one(!!!) luggage cart and getting it from the main building to our building was a bit of an adventure. We did speak to the manager on duty regarding getting a cart for all three buildings, which would be extremely helpful to travellers with luggage. The hotel consists of three separate buildings connected by pretty walkways with extensive and lush landscaping throughout. Service was excellent and always pleasant. There are separate lounges in each of the buildings where there is free: Haagen Dazs ice cream cups, fruit, local Tim's potato chips, the best chocolate malt balls I have ever tasted, chocolate covered raisins, yogurt and string cheese, plus local Talking Rain water. We stayed in a studio suite, which is extremely spacious for two with a murphy bed. The decor is light and airy and modern, as evidenced in the other areas of the hotel. Though we enjoyed our room, it seemed a bit "office-ish" and on the hotel website we noticed later that the bed is put up to turn the room into a conference room. Though comfortable, I would not recommend it for a romantic getaway. As another reviewer noted, the queen bed is probably not a full queen as it seemed slightly small to us, but was very comfortable and we had a great sleep. I also would have appreciated some bedside lighting -- there is none for those of you who like to read in bed. The bathroom was well-lit and the deep soaker tub most enjoyable; the shower had excellent shower pressure. Wifi was slow at times, but otherwise worked well. The restaurant has amazing local farm to table organic cusine on par with restaurants downtown. Even you've got a fairly long layover between flights, consider the short trip on their shuttle to have some great local Northwest food. Also, the continental breakfast is fairly extensive - bagels, smoked salmon, fruits and cereals and pastries -- you would be hard-pressed to find nothing to eat. This hotel is an amazing value and really -- trust me, you can tell from my reviews we stay in many hotels -- DON'T stay anywhere else in the SeaTac area. We will be returning in December.

Reviews.Title: “Wish we had known about this place sooner!!!”
Reviews.Author: TandTHayes
Reviews.Content: We had the most wonderful experience staying here... the location was beautiful, tranquil and still convenient. Our first night we headed to the lounge for a quick bite and had the best burger ever, along with great conversation with the bartender. We loved the style of the hotel and our room - it is elegant and woodsy and very cozy. The complimentary breakfasts was wonderful and we wish we could have had more meals at the hotel, but had made other plans prior to booking our room. We loved the living room area and the excersize room! I will never stay at another hotel in Seattle again - this is it for us!

Reviews.Title: “Like!”
Reviews.Author: ninapod
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful hotel. Lovely rooms and staff, amazing breakfast, very close to Seatac but in a serene woodsy setting. The wifi was very weak in my room, which was my only complaint, albeit an important one since I was working. Otherwise an amazing stay at an unbelievable price, especially with the advance purchase deal.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Beachgirl555
Reviews.Content: If you are traveling to Seattle, stay here! Excellent in every way. Only 15 minutes to Seattle. Food to die for and reasonably priced. Great roomy bathrooms with oversized tub. Serene tasteful understated decor. Gourmet breakfast included. We used AARP to get an even better price. Don't bother with the inflated fee hotels in Seattle, stay here, you won't be sorry. So glad I took the advice of Tripadvisor, we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: Seoul_power
Reviews.Content: Very nice, prompt shuttle to airport, nice clean modern comfortable room, friendly helpful staff, beautiful grounds, and complimentary ice cream and bottles of water.

Reviews.Title: “It's all true...”
Reviews.Author: suitcaseinhandBoston
Reviews.Content: This was by far the best hotel experience I have ever had... From the moment you enter the hotel grounds, the ambiance is warm and comforting. The staff greeted us as if we were old friends (it was our first visit) and provided thorough information about the hotel and its amenities. Our room (and the entire hotel) was spotless and included a feature that most hotels miss- a well lit bathtub/shower. The wireless internet was indeed free with no strings attached. The Living Room was wonderful- a cozy room with stone fireplace and furniture for relaxing while enjoying a complimentary (in my case, ice cream) treat.The bed was so comfy and the room quiet. The complimentary breakfast was plentiful, varied and delicious. And all for an exceptionally reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location for corporate meetings”
Reviews.Author: bosslady2011
Reviews.Content: Wonderful rooms and exquisite meeting facility! The little extra perks provided make this a wonderful location not only for business meeting, but for hotel room stay as well. Wonderful ambiance!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience; looking forward to staying here again!”
Reviews.Author: CoffeeHound58
Reviews.Content: After a long day of international travel, I had the pleasure of spending one night at Cedarbrook Lodge. It was the ideal spot to recharge before flying out the next day for Alaska. The customer service was first-rate, from start to finish. The room was extremely quiet and comfortable, and I enjoyed the bathroom products AND the coffee maker (complete with Starbucks coffee, and large coffee mugs) very much. Especially comforting was the complimentary snacks in the parlor - from fruit and cheese to ice cream! I was very hungry after a long day of traveling, and these really hit the spot. The next morning, I devoured the complimentary breakfast, which was a wonderful assortment of both hot and cold items. Everything was delicious. The staff was very friendly and helpful; customer service was first-rate. If traveling through Seattle again, I will certainly stay at Cedarbrook Lodge.

Reviews.Title: “A beautifully landscaped quiet and elegant hotel enticing you to return.”
Reviews.Author: Kay39
Reviews.Content: This hotel comprises several buildings in a beautifully landscaped surrounding. The rooms are large, comfortable, and immaculate. Each lodge has a large living room with fireplace, large screen TV and snacks. I hope someday to be able to return to Seattle and this hotel will be my residence.

Reviews.Title: “Defintelty a diamond in the rough”
Reviews.Author: howjan
Reviews.Content: Just returned from first visit to northwest. Decided on Cedarbrook Lodge based on reviews read here. We decided not to rent a car from airport due to 30 percent higher rate so decided to rent downtown. I was initally hesitant to stay what I thought was far from downtown area, but to my pleasure I found Cedarbrook to be perfectly located. We were able to receive a ride from the hotel to the light rail which took you right into downtown. Our first impression was fantastic. We had booked our first two nights here because we had planned to see Oregon and Olympic Mountains but we knew we would need a place to stay on our last night before flying out of Seattle. It took us two seconds to decide to stay again on our last night. From the first encounter with the drive to the airport you got a feeling of staying with friends instead of a hotel. The grounds and central areas are beautiful and peaceful. We enjoyed a cocktail outside by the fireplace and had a lovely chat with one of the waiters. We have traveled quite a bit and have never experienced such a warm and inviting atmosphere. My husband is a carpenter and was really impressed the structure of the building. I hate to spread the word too loudly because I don't ever want it to change. I can't recommend this hotel with any higher praise. The breakfast was great, the rooms clean, the staff like family, the special rooms with snacks 24 hours, the drinks were way above our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “I'm a believer”
Reviews.Author: jack783
Reviews.Content: I've been to Seattle many times on business and have always stayed at the downtown hotels. This time I had some meetings near the the airport and decided to try out Cedarbrook for two nights. What a great experience. As other reviewers have said you would never know you're only several minutes from the airport. The Lodge is in sort of a residential area and I didn't hear or see an airplane the entire stay. The facility was really built for conferences and is set up so that you can stay on the grounds for several days and not feel cooped up. There is one main building with reception, restaurant, etc. and three additional buildings, each 3 stories, with the guest rooms. The feeling is homey and spacious. Each guest building has a lounge with a pantry with the much-discussed free snacks. Free parking and free wired and wireless internet in the room although my room got spotty wifi reception. I did not see many other guests so either the buildings absorb the activity really well or their occupancy is low. The guest room seemed a little small to me considering how spacious the rest of the facility is but it was well appointed, clean and modern. The bathroom in particular was nice--well lit and plenty of counter space. We had dinner in the restaurant. I found the quality excellent and would compare it to any standalone restaurant. Prices were reasonable and they participate in Restaurant Week so they had a $25 3-course menu that was great value. Service all-around in the hotel and restaurant was attentive. The staff tends to be younger so they are not up to the level of say a concierge at a high end hotel, but they try hard and are friendly. I don't know what year the resort was built but it seems new and is spotlessly maintained. I understand Washington Mutual used to own it but since they were sold to JP Morgan I don't know who took it over. Anyway, the quality does not seem to have suffered at all.

Reviews.Title: “plush extras + service with a smile”
Reviews.Author: meganvee
Reviews.Content: Upon entering the lobby, we were greeted with a smile and promptly checked in even though we arrived several hours before check-in. The room was nice and modern with eco-friendly toiletries, robes, down comforters and pillows, a long counter for working, and best of all, free wi-fi through-out the entire campus. Oh, wait, I lied, the best part was the 24-hour snack stand filled with water, coffee, chocolate covered pretzels and malt-balls, fruit, yogurt, and ice cream! The breakfast was great for US standards, ok for European standards. Only 5 minutes (by car) to the southcenter shopping mall and 5 minutes to the airport. Free shuttle provide to airport and mall. A perfect hotel if you want to be near the airport/mall.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel! Other hotel chains did not compare!”
Reviews.Author: MsViaje
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 days and 4 nights. Our room was available as soon we checked in at around 3 pm. The staff was very friendly and helpful. They were always available to answer questions regarding shuttle schedule, places to go and restaurant recommendations. The lodge had a very calming resort feel, considering that they are about 5 minutes away from the airport. Shuttle can take you to the airport, the light rail station and the Westfield Mall at Tukwila for some mall shopping. Taking the light rail was very easy and affordable especially going downtown Seattle. Amidst a residential neighborhood, you can't even tell that there is a hotel/lodge nearby. Beautiful surroundings, peaceful and serene.... Perfect place to relax and unwind... Our stay came with continental breakfast and each lodge/building had free water, snacks, yogurt and even ice cream! Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “A lovely lodge in a natural setting just one mile from Seatac airport!”
Reviews.Author: annlemery
Reviews.Content: I don't know why anyone would stay anywhere else once they find this spot. I wish I had more reasons to come here! Great place, great food, great service. I felt like I was on vacation instead of a conference!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, will be coming back in the Future!!”
Reviews.Author: precious_lub
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay! Very nice, comfortable, loved the way the layout of rooms was set up. Great bathroom, spacious! Loved the lighting in the room. Free water, ice cream, yogurt in lounge fridge. Overall, it was very warm and comfortable!! I will definitely come back in the future, number one choice!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful surprise.”
Reviews.Author: MuffetMardi
Reviews.Content: We needed to be down by the airport for a conference but the conference hotel was full. The glowing reviews made us give Cedarbrook Lodge a try. And we were so glad. It is beautiful, serene, wonderful - you'd never believe you are near the airport. The airport location, while convenient for travel or conferences, means that you are not close to downtown Seattle. That said, I would seriously consider staying at Cedarbrook and just planning for the commute into Seattle on a future trip. It is THAT nice!

Reviews.Title: “awesome”
Reviews.Author: Judith029
Reviews.Content: Very friendly,beautiful setting with a feeling of being in the country,not 5 minutes from the airport.The restaurant has excellent food,prices appropriate for the quality,breakfast very extensive and varied,included in the room,my husband liked the steel cut oatmeal,I liked the smoked salmon.We used the transportation to the airport which was efficient and friendly.The rooms were comfortable and the in room coffee was good,not the usual dishwater.The lounge area with snacks was a really nice feature.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: lin5521
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel after reading the good reviews on tripadvisor and we weren't disappointed. The lodge is located on a very well maintained landscaped ground. Room was comfortable and quiet with a big size bathroom. The complementary breakfast, snacks, internet and parking were a real bonus. We will definetiy stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Must stay . A true gem.”
Reviews.Author: funwithfamily2010
Reviews.Content: Location: next to the airport but u wouldn't realize that. Free pickup and drop off. Also free shuttle to convenient location for the Sky train to downtown Seattle. B'fast and dining options: 5 star quality at reasonable prices. Free snacks (ice creams, water, yogurt etc) 24/7 Gym/ Internet: Great! Missed the pool but they mentioned that they were probably going to work out something with the YMCA next door. Rooms : Absolutely comfortable. Dark shades available. Several channels (more than Marriott). Free small library with interesting books.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Duwayne
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay...off the beaten trail. Quiet and clean...near the airport. Hotel employees were great and helpful. Free snacks were great and well stocked. Will consider using this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel / Lodge”
Reviews.Author: Ladeniji
Reviews.Content: This hotel is so close to the airport, yet you would never know it is anywhere near an airport. They have done such a marvelous job of creating a "lodge" feel. The food, service, staff, accomodations are all top notch. I would stay here anytime I had the chance.

Reviews.Title: “Blissful alternative given the area”
Reviews.Author: AuntLucille
Reviews.Content: We chose Cedarbrook as a way-station, given that reaching Sea-Tac airport takes most of a day from our home, and flying to the East Coast yet another day. I've stayed in or gone to conferences at several Sea-Tac hotels, and grew up three miles from the airport (and area now condemned due to noise). I could not believe the claims about Cedarbrook could exist given the highly developed area. The moment we arrived, we were surrounded by gardens and water features. The people who worked there were fairly friendly and helpful. We could sit in a little lounge and eat and drink free stuff, or we could hang out in our room, which had a comfortable bed. We had an excellent dinner - good food and design, and the hotel made sure we caught our flight in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “The only place to stay near the airport...”
Reviews.Author: EnviroSci
Reviews.Content: The only place to stay near the airport! This place is everything everyone said it was. Fabulous room (suite with fireplace), gourmet food, like-new everything, free snacks, internet, breakfast. Well insulated rooms, could barely hear the planes. We had room service dinner which was delicious. We will definitely use this place again and highly recommend it. The people were super- friendly also.

Reviews.Title: “Seattle'e Best Kept Secret”
Reviews.Author: vocaliss
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this place! I was impressed with what I saw online but it is WAY better in person. The grounds are breathtaking, the service is impeccable and you will love the 24-hour snack bar. Yes, folks I said 24-hour snack bar with all-you-can-eat Haagen Daazs ice cream!!!! The room amenities are great. I love the soaps (great quality). The location is conveniently located 5 mins from the airport and nestled in a quiet neighbourhood. This place will force others to raise their standards. Very relaxing atmosphere. Believe me, you will not be disappointed!!

Reviews.Title: “Relax,Adventure and Fun”
Reviews.Author: dayvid13
Reviews.Content: The Cedarbrook Lodge is a must stay. I know you are thinking ... Oh so close to the airport how could it possibly be all you say. Well it is and more. Now you can take the adventurous route as my wife and I did and not rent a car and light rail it downtown where everything was well within close proximity to the rail or you can just rent a car. The Hotel is well worth any minor inconvenience it may have, by not being down town (if you call that an inconvenience).... I don't. I just think of Cedarbrook as a beautiful little haven to retreat too after a long day of work or sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel near the airport”
Reviews.Author: CmarieM
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Cedarbrook on the last day of our 10 day vacation. We needed some place near the airport as we had a very early morning flight. However, I wanted to stay somewhere interesting to prolong our vacation . We dropped out rental car off right after we checked in and the Cedarbrook shuttle picked us up and took us back to the lodge. There was a business center where we were able to check in for our flight and print boarding passes. Every member of the staff was very friendly and helpful. The hotel is beautiful with lovely gardens and landscaping surrounding it. We had a very nice dinner in the restaurant by the fireplace. Our stay at Cedarbrook allowed us to enjoy our last day of vacation.

Reviews.Title: “relaxing and rejuvinating”
Reviews.Author: traveler97007
Reviews.Content: the staff was excellent. we had just gotten off the cruise and arrived way before check in. they were able to let us check in early.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: rennie93
Reviews.Content: We journeyed from Canada and arrived at Cedarbrook in the evening, for a one-night stay prior to an early flight from Sea-Tac. The place was so wonderful we wished we had a longer stay ! A little jewel, in its own pleasant grounds, quiet although 5 mins from airport. Lovely little touches like high-quality toiletries, and lounge with free water, yoghurt, snacks including ice-cream. Dinner in restaurant very good. Staff universally helpful and friendly. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Destination to remember and reccomend”
Reviews.Author: fdelkin
Reviews.Content: Front desk, dining staff were welcoming & helpful...dining menu, preparation superb...access from I-5 somewhat tricky...wonderful surprise that it is adjacent to Seatac, but a world apart and surprisingly quiet despite being below the flight pattern. ...definitely a good value and an ideal lodging,dining solution for air travelers

Reviews.Title: “Very very very nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: joecanada2
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay, nice room, quite, included breakfast was great. Snacks in the common room are really nice. All in all a great place to stay; would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “amazing place”
Reviews.Author: GirlsTrip10
Reviews.Content: We traveled from VA for a 'girls' trip and was so impressed with the lodge. It was gorgeous and the service was excellent. We will definitely stay again on our next Seattle trip.

Reviews.Title: “Best airport hotel ever!”
Reviews.Author: CaroleHWebster_NY
Reviews.Content: The atmosphere at Cedarbrook is lovely and serene, with nicely landscaped grounds, restful rooms, and an outstanding restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “very quiet for being close to the airport”
Reviews.Author: captainmidwest
Reviews.Content: Very close to the airport and beautiful grounds. Complementary water and various treats were appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “A 5 star country club feel 5 mins from the airport!”
Reviews.Author: ozeeboy
Reviews.Content: We thought the reviews for this quite affordable property might have been overdone. But it's all true. Beautiful grounds, extremely quiet, super staff. Just wish we'd stayed more than 1 night. It used to be an exclusive retreat for Washington Mutual execs - and you can stay there now for the price of a Hampton Inn or Radisson. Don't miss this gem. Did I mention the 24/7 complimentary ice cream, fruit, chocolate. Only complaint: no panel TVs yet but large normal TVs. And no nightlife.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect. Beautitul. absolutely wonderful”
Reviews.Author: cruisetravelagent55
Reviews.Content: I travel extensively and this is the nicest hotel I have stayed in in a long time. It is beautiful, has the feeling of being up on the mountains, grounds are well kept, and the snacks are such a nice addition. There is a free shuttle to take you where you want to go with hardly any wait. This is on my list for me and my clients.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis in the city.”
Reviews.Author: fsdx2
Reviews.Content: This was truly a diamond in the rough. From the moment we arrived, the entire staff made us feel as though our stay was important to them. The grounds are park-like and the lodge is very clean (the outdoor lighting was being dusted as we departed!). The breakfast (included) was a refreshing departure from runny scrambled eggs and greasy bacon! And the little touches such as chocolates, water and ice cream, made us feel pampered. We were a little disappointed in the beds, which were adequate, but not great. The rooms were somewhat small, but very well appointed. We had just come from a stay at a pricier downtown Seattle hotel and this was a far better experience! I would definitely recommend Cedarbrook to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “It's the place to stay in Seattle!”
Reviews.Author: Zanby
Reviews.Content: My Seattle visit was from Sep 10-13, 2010 where I stayed at the Dogwood Dream Suite. I have been living, pretty much, in 4-5 stars hotels the whole year and I can 'smell' the difference. Pros... - Excellent internet wireless speeds any where in the lodge (5 MB/s) albeit, some spots (like the bed area) didn't get enough of a signal for a Netflix movie. I had to use my Mi-Fi for that - Quality Natura products and amenities used in bathroom (towels, robe, soaps, shampoos, etc) - No valet parking. In another word, I didn't have to pay for waiting on somebody to bring my car whenever I needed access to it! - Close to Airport - Great value for the money! - Meaningful breakfast and for free - Free menu bar with water, soda, ice cream, fruits, etc - Coffee in room Cons... - Location might not suit you if you want the city and/or the ocean lake view - Breakfast time ends a bit too early during the week (9:30 AM) All in all, if you don't care much about being close to the city, it's the place to stay in Seattle!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: jasonasu99
Reviews.Content: Cedarbrook Lodge not only met our expectations, but far exceeded them! The free transport to the light rail made getting to and from the city a snap. The free snacks and ice cream were a wonderful touch. The free breakfast was good and the smoked salmon each morning was a nice touch. I would certainly recommend this to anyone going to the Seattle area!

Reviews.Title: “blew me away”
Reviews.Author: tickettoride
Reviews.Content: I arrived crabby after a long flight and wait for the shuttle to pick me up but it didnt take long to cheer me up..this place is new,modern and totally zen....this place MUST be run by a woman...It is 5 minutes from Sea-Tack but seems like it's in an oasis of calm in Alaska...totally quiet and serene.I was bowled over by the snack bar lounges in each building..chips,cheese,oranges,ice cream and those fabulous malted balls and choco-raisens...I soaked in the tub and scaked until I was in Bliss! The bed was a heaven bed with down pillow and was out like a light in 5 minutes..The property is gorgeous but the breakfast was right up my alley...I had a bagel and cream cheese with caper and onions ...fruit pastries and greak starbucks coffee...what a great start to the day...I hope I get to come back agin as this place could be an actual destination for the weary!! and frequent flyer...keep up the good work

Reviews.Title: “Look no further, this is the place to stay”
Reviews.Author: kcbear
Reviews.Content: We were very impressed with Cedarbrook lodge, wanted to stay close to Sea-Tec airport which was short driving distance. The room was very spacious, the queen beds are plush and very comfortable. Staff very friendly, I would rate this a 5 star resort and would not hesitate to stay again. The most impressive service provided was complimentary guest bar, in the downstairs lobby, before going to our room, the fridge was stocked with ice cream, water, string cheese, yogurt. I regret we only could stay one night.. If we ever travel to Seattle/Tacoma area again Cedarbrook lodge would be my first choice.

Reviews.Title: “An unexpected gem”
Reviews.Author: 20dragonflys
Reviews.Content: Located near the airport, it is a gem of beauty and serenity. Great service, great food and the facilities are terrific. Don't miss it if you need to stay near the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding! We were looking for a...”
Reviews.Author: rcw21
Reviews.Content: Outstanding! We were looking for a resort/hotel close to the airport for our final night in Seattle. We found Cedarbrook too late and unfortunately only stayed one night. If we'd spotted the lodge during our original vacation planning we would've stayed the entire 12 days with them. It's that good! Upon arrival you wouldn't expect to find such an amazing lodge tucked away so close to the airport and surrounding neighborhoods. We didn't hear any airport noise whatsoever. The landscaping surrounding the lodge is outstanding. Everything was perfectly manicured. The lobby was amazing, offering a bar, dining and a blazing fireplace to sit by! The building our room was located in had a meeting place/living room built into the middle where all guests staying in the controlled access building could grab free chips, fruit, candy, water, ice cream and more while relaxing on the couch. A huge wall of books were there for use along with a tv. That's the coolest thing ever! Having access to only your room once in wouldn't be a bad thing because they are outstanding too, but this was such a nice touch! The room offered a huge window with views of the landscaping. The window could be opened to allow fresh air in (again, no airport noise). The bed was super-comfy with plenty of fresh linens. The bathroom was complete with plenty of toiletries. Starbucks coffee was included in the room for brewing too! We had/have absolutely no complaints with Cedarbrook whatsoever. Stay here, I guarantee you will not be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nkp
Reviews.Content: Everything about Cedarbrook was perfect. Before stepping into the hotel you pass through lovely flowers and landscaping. The staff is warm and helpful. Each floor has a fully stocked lounge where you can munch and read all night. The breakfast included everything from smoked salmon to fresh fruit.
